loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ana Consuelo

texts.es: Ana Consuelo vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, pan, leche, jabón, entre otros, tiene varios años de trabajar en su negocio y le ha dado muy buenos resultados, está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico es muy conocida por ser la tienda mas surtida, se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad y a precios accesibles, además el servicio es excelente; Ana es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan demostrarse a sí misma que puede llegar al éxito con trabajo duro y dedicación; la demanda ha aumentado por eso necesita invertir más en productos para no decepcionar a los clientes por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, golosinas, producto instantáneo, jabones etc. Ana Consuelo tiene buenas referencias  de pago y es muy responsable, esta agradecida con la ayuda y tiene la certeza que podrá pagar la deuda, a la vez darle a su familia la vida completa y plena como se la merecen.
texts.en: Ana Consuelo lives with her life partner and their children in their own house. She has a store where she sells basic household goods such as grains, bread, milk and soap among other items. She has been working at this business for many years and it has had good success. It is located in a busy area. It is popular as it is a well- stocked store. She has a lot of customers that prefer her store as she sells good quality products for a fair price. In addition she provides excellent service. Ana is an enterprising woman with a great desire to succeed. She is always looking for new opportunities to grow and to be successful through hard work and dedication. She has increase her customer base so she needs to buy more products so that her customers aren’t disappointed. This is why she is asking for this loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy grains, bread, hard candy, instant food, soap, etc. Ana Consuelo is known for paying her payments on time and is very responsible. She is thankful for the help and is certain she can pay off this debt. With her earnings she can provide her family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, hard candy, instant food and soap.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un carpintero que vive en la ciudad de Lambaré, se dedica a este trabajo hace mas de 20 años y tiene un local en su casa, donde tiene todas las herramientas necesarias para el trabajo que hace.
Juan es una persona muy trabajadora que se ha hecho muy conocida por el excelente trabajo que hace, tiene muy buena referencia con sus clientes y es por eso que le va muy bien y esta creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de maderas, clavos, tornillos y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes, ya que esta es la forma de ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a carpenter who lives in the city of Lambaré. He began doing this work more than 20 years ago, and he has a small shop in his house, where he has all of the necessary tools for the work that he does. 

Juan is a very hardworking person who has made himself very well known because of the excellent work that he does. He has very good references with his customers, and it’s because of this that his business is going well for him and is growing.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy wood, nails, screws, and other supplies in order to continue working and filling his customers’ orders, as this is his way of helping out his family.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, screws, and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Sara es la tesorera de Banco Mujer Mujeres Unidas,  tiene 33 años y es madre de 4 hijos, todos menores de edad, que estudian en primaria y secundaria. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, Se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos, también trabaja medio tiempo en el comedor de la escuela de su comunidad todo para ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios, mejorar las condiciones y el entorno en el que viven. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita Sara y su grupo, ella va a invertir en la  sus compra de pollos, y sus alimentos para aumentar su producción. 
El grupo de Sara está compuesto por 6 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias y comerciales.
texts.en:
Sara is the treasurer of the "Mujer Manos Unidas" ["Woman Hands Together"] communal bank. She is 33 years old and she is the mother of four children, all of them minors, who study in primary and secondary school. 

Sara is a very hardworking woman who earns her living raising chickens and pigs. She also works part-time in the cafeteria of her community school, all to help her children with their education and to improve the conditions and the environment in which they live. 

This is the third loan that Sara and her group have requested. She will invest it in the purchase of chickens along with feed to increase their production.

Sara's group is composed of six more members who are going to invest in commercial and agricultural businesses.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed.

loans.name: José Adán

texts.es: José Adán vive junto a su compañera de vida e hijo  en casa propia; el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas lo prefieren y lo mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes,  ; José es un hombre dedicado a su labor, enérgico y con muchas metas por delante, su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito, es la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, como todo buen comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. José Adán tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Adán lives with his life partner and child in their own house; he has a store where he sells basic necessities, beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among other things. He has had this business for many years, and this has given him sales experience, which allows him to get better earnings. 

The business is located where he lives in a well-frequented area. He has gained many customers because he has the best-stocked store. People prefer him, and he keeps ahead of the competition because he always has what they need, with high quality products at affordable prices and with unrivaled service, always at the beck and call of the customers.

José is a man who is dedicated to his work, energetic, and with many goals for getting ahead. His greatest secret for achieving success is perseverance and love of the work. He knows that this is the only way he will achieve what he wants. 

Like every good businessman, he wants to expand his business and make a new investment, but he lacks the capital. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow him to purchase basic grains, candy, bread, drinks, etc. 

José Adán has good payment references; he assures that he will pay off the debt, and at the same time, he trusts that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, candy, eggs, bread, and drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals (nutritious grains).

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia Patricia vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en  casa propia, ella posee una librería donde vende artículos escolares  como cuadernos, lapiceros, papel, paginas entre otros, ya tiene amplia experiencia en las ventas lo que le permite obtener siempre muy buenas ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su residencia, es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela,  tiene ventaja porque no hay mucha competencia en los alrededores,  la gente la prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad y a excelentes precios, además el servicio es muy bueno; Claudia es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre dispuesta a cumplir todas las oportunidades que se le presentan para así  alcanzar el éxito, uno de sus más grandes sueños  es acrecentar el negocio  aprovechando el comienzo de año escolar, pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar cuadernos, papel, lapiceros, colores etc. Claudia Patricia tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable esta muy agradecida con la ayuda y  sabe que podrá cancelar la deuda,  al mismo tiempo que le dara a su familia una vida plena que cubra sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Claudia Patricia lives with her life partner and their children in their own house.  She has a bookstore where she sells school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, paper, etc.  She already has extensive experience in sales, which allows her to always obtain the best profits.  Her business is located in her house, is well known in the area and has gained many customers.  She has an advantage in that there isn't a lot of competition in the surrounding area.  People prefer her because she always has what they need, has quality products, and excellent prices.  In addition, the service is very good.

Claudia is a very hardworking woman and is always willing to meet all opportunities that come her way.  In this way, she obtains success.

One of her biggest dreams is to increase her business, taking advantage of the start of the school year.  However, she is in need of funds.  For this reason, she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy notebooks, paper, pencils, colored pencils, etc.

Claudia Patricia has good payment references and is very responsible.  She is very thankful for the help and knows that she will be able to settle her debt.  At the same time, she knows that it will give her family a full life that will meet their needs.=

loans.use: buy notebooks, paper, pencils, and colored pencils.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 33 years old and has a retail business in Emali town. She sells food stuffs like bread, milk, rice, sugar and flour as well as detergents and other retail goods. She is a single mother of two school going children.

This will be her first loan, and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of goods for resale in her business. These include five bundles of maize, flour, a 90 KG bag of sugar, rice and milk. She also plans to buy more stock of detergents and bar soap. She anticipates making more profit with which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Jackline hopes to expand her retail business and open a wholesale shop, hence, to make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods for resale.

loans.name: Sinore

texts.en: Sinore is 52 years old, married and blessed with six children that she supports. She is a maize farmer and has been in the farming activity for the past four years. Her monthly income is 24,000 KES.  She has applied for her fourth loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD to purchase farm inputs and prepare the land. She intends to use the anticipated profits to reinvest. Her future dream is to be successful in her venture.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Tacuaree Poty Group

texts.es:
El comite Takuare Poty son de la ciudad de San Lorenzo son 23 integrantes  muy responsables, ellas participaron de la eliminación de pobreza en el año 2011 y año 2012 se le hizo el seguimiento y todas siguen en verde gracias al trabajo que ellas están haciendo.
Todas son mamas muy responsables y trabajadoras se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier problema del grupo, ayudan a su comunidad siempre y entre ellas también todas para que así puedan salir adelante juntas.
El crédito que solicitan ahora son todo para sus ventas ambulantes en la zona,  lo hacen con lluvia o no con la ayuda, para poder ayudar a sus hijos y maridos que le ayudan en la ventas. La  señora Georgelina por solicita este crédito para la compra de ropas ya que ella  trabaja de manera independiente con la ayuda de su familia.
texts.en:
The group Tacuaree Poty is from the city of San Lorenzo and has 23 very responsible members. They participated in the eradication of poverty in the years 2011 and 2012; they did the follow-up, and all of them continued in “green”, thanks to the work that they are doing.

All of them are very hardworking and responsible mothers. They always get together to resolve any problems in the group. They always help their community and also each other, so that in this way, they can get ahead together.

The loan that they are requesting now is for ambulatory sales in the area. They do this in the rain and with no assistance, in order to help their children and spouses who help them with their sales. 

Georgelina is requesting this loan for the purchase of clothing, as she works independently with the help of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sammy's Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of six members who have been accessing loans from ID Ghana (MFI) since 2011. They are Samuel, Mercy, Priscilla, Paulina, Richard and Lydia. Samuel and Richard sell shoes. Paulina sells provision. Mercy sells fish. Priscilla sells soft drinks, and Lydia sells material respectively. ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through ID Ghana's services. 

Samuel is a 30-year-old shoe seller. He has five years working experience. He works six days in a week (from Monday to Saturday). He is constantly working to improve upon his business capital. This is his fourth loan with ID Ghana, and he is requesting an amount of 1,400 GHS to buy shoes to sell to his customers in the community.

The group needs a total amount of 6,000 GHS for business expansion and to meet customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Francisco Eduardo

texts.es:
Francisco nació en Manta. Tiene como negocio la producción de bloques para construccion con tierra, leña, aserrín, etc. Este negocio lo empezó desde los 13 años con su familia y actualmente tiene un negocio propio hace un año. 
Quiere seguir incrementando su negocio porque desde pequeño es todo lo que ha hecho. El trabajo lo realiza con un trabajador que lo acompaña desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde.

En su negocio tiene la producción de tierra, leña y aserrín, la dificultad que tiene en su negocio es su enfermedad y el mal tiempo. El cliente es un hombre soltero, sin hijos. Se dedica solo a su negocio y a su bienestar propio, para ello requiere de su apoyo.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar tierra, leña, aserrin para hacer mas bloques para construccion. El metas y sueños del cliente con este apoyo es poder obtener materiales para mayor disposición y mas trabajadores para hacer mas ladrillos para asi poder tener un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Francisco was born in Manta. He has a business of producing construction blocks out of dirt, wood, sawdust, and other materials. Francisco started in this line of work 13 years ago with his family, but now he has managed his own business for one year. He wants to continue growing his business since this type of work is all he has ever known since childhood. Francisco completes the work with an assistant who accompanies him. They work from 5:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M.

In his business, he works with dirt, wood, and sawdust. The challenges he faces in his business include dealing with illnesses and bad weather. Franciso is a single man with no children. He manages his business alone for his own welfare, so he is in need of assistance. With this loan, he will be able to buy dirt, wood, and sawdust for making more building blocks. His goals and dreams with this loan include obtaining additional materials to have on hand. He would also like to have more workers so that he can produce more bricks, thereby generating more income.

loans.use: to buy dirt, wood, and sawdust for making construction blocks.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane  habite au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et a choisi de faire du commerce pour subvenir à ses besoins. En effet, Il dispose d’un magasin de vente d’articles de mercerie qu’il  gère depuis 6 ans. A travers ce qu’il gagne il parvient à supporter les charges de location du magasin de même que ses besoins personnels. C’est un membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il sollicite son sixième crédit d’un montant de 300.000 francs CFA. L’objet de son prêt est  l’achat de produits de mercerie en vue d’augmenter le stock de son magasin. Il démarre sa journée de travail  à 9 heures du matin pour la terminer à 18 heures. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux se prendre en charge. produit  suffisant.  Son futur projet est de renforcer son activité en créant d’autres magasins de vente d’articles de mercerie. Son projet dan s le futur est de disposer d’autres magasins de mercerie
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane live in Senegal. He is married and has chosen to work in commerce to support himself. Basically, he has a store selling sewing supplies that he has been running for six years. With what he earns, he manages to cover his lease payments, as well as his personal needs. 

He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where he is requesting his sixth loan in the amount of 300,000 francs CFA. The goal of his loan is to purchase sewing items with the aim of increasing his store inventory. He starts his workday at 9:00 in the morning and finishes at 6:00 PM. Increasing his profits will enable him to do better supporting himself [and obtaining] sufficient inventory. His future plan is to bolster his business by establishing other stores selling sewing supplies.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies to resell

loans.name: Teresa Carolina

texts.es: Teresa Carolina vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, pan, jabones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de experiencia valiosa en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores  ganancias, comercia desde su hogar que esta en una zona muy transitada, siempre esta delante de su competencia pues su tienda es la mas surtida, los  clientes  la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y el excelente servicio; Teresa es una mujer dedicada a su labor, activa y con muchas metas que desea alcanzar, dia a dia se esfuerza con constancia y amor al trabajo porque sabe que así logrará el éxito que tanto desea, en el ultimo mes de venta aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, huevos, bebidas, jabones, etc. Teresa Carolina tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa Carolina lives together with her life partner and their three children; she has a store where she sells basic needs items, like basic grains, milk, eggs, bread, and soap, among others. She has had this business for some years and has gained valuable sales experience that allows her to get better earnings.

She sells from her home, which is in a well-frequented area. She is always ahead of her competition, as her store is the best-stocked. Her customers prefer her because of her quality, good prices, and the excellent service. 

Teresa is a woman who is dedicated to her work and active, with many goals that she wishes to reach. Day after day, she makes an effort with perseverance and love for her work, because she knows that only in this way will she achieve the success that she desires so much.

In the last month of sales, her demand increased, and she wants to take advantage of this in order to make a new investment. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy basic grains, candy, instant products, eggs, drinks, soap, etc. 

Teresa Carolina has good payment references and irreproachable morals. She is grateful for the support, and she assures that she will be able to pay off the debt. At the same time, she trusts that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, candy, instant products, eggs, drinks, and soap.

loans.name: Antolin

texts.es:
El Sr. Antolín es un hombre soltero que vive en la ciudad de Curuguaty, cuenta que tiene su propia casa, su actividad principal es  la compra de Queso de la zona rural de Villa Ygatimi y lo lleva a vender en la ciudad capital (Asunción) también en esa cuidad se  dedica a vender los productos embutidos que trae de la fábricas de la capital, ademas cuenta con una  cantina en un centro de recreación desde hace 20 años, donde vende bebidas y comidas rápidas todos los fines de semana y los días que los eventos se llevan a cabo en el mismo lugar, éstos son sus fuentes de ingresos.
Como se puede ver, Antolin es una persona muy trabajadora y que lucha por salir adelante para crecer como microempresario. El solicita de este crédito para la compra de queso y embutidos para la venta, para poder tener un stock de ellos ya que siempre esta cargado de pedidos.
texts.en:
Sr. Antolín is a single gentleman who lives in his own house in the city of Curuguaty. His main business activity involves buying cheese in the rural district of Villa Ygatimi and taking to the capital city of Asunción to sell. He also sells sausages that are produced at the plants in the capital. In addition, he manages a cantina that has served as a center of recreation for the past 20 years. There he sells beverages and fast food on the weekends and on days when special events are held at his establishment. These businesses are his sources of income.

As one can see, Antolín is a hardworking person who strives to grow as a micro-entrepreneur. He is requesting a loan in order to buy cheese and sausages to sell. This will enable him to maintain his inventory so that he can always be ready to fulfill his orders.

loans.use: to buy cheese and sausages to sell.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian has a grocery business in Emali town where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, cereals and fruits. She has been in the business for the past seven years and it has been profitable. She is 36 years old and a single mother to one child who is in primary school.

This being her first loan term, she plans to use the amount to add stock of grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, carrots and potatoes. She also plans to buy more stock of fruits like mangoes and oranges. This will enable her to have enough stock to meet the demands of her customers.

She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her child. Marian hopes to grow her grocery business by selling a wider variety of grocery items and also move to a permanent store which she intends to acquire in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of carrots, potatoes and mangoes.

loans.name: Adonai Group

texts.es:
El comite de Adonai es de la zona de San Lorenzo, las miembros son señoras que salieron de la pobreza en el 2011 se trabajo mucho con cada una de ellas y sus familias por medio de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
La señora Juana, la presidenta, por ejemplo tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la que ayuda a su familia y con este negocio ha podido ir creciendo y mejorando sus ingresos.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser carne, bebidas, pan, leche, verduras y demás.
texts.en:
The Adonai group is from the San Lorenzo region. The members are women who rose out of poverty in 2011; a lot of work was done with each one of them and their families by means of a survey about the eradication of poverty. 

For example, Juana, the president, has a well-stocked storeroom, with which she helps her family. With this business, she has been able to grow and improve her earnings.

She is requesting this loan in order to invest in the purchase of supplies for her stock of food, such as meat, drinks, bread, milk, vegetables, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase meat, drinks, bread, milk, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea-tree seedlings.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam's business is doing well. She was able to repay the loan on time and also meet the needs of her family well. She is grateful for the support.

Mariam would like to invest further into the business. She is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to pay for the purchase of vegetables and other groceries for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and groceries.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de tela, Atlántida junto a sus hijos y su abuela. Cecilia lleva tres años de tener su propio negocio de pulpería, donde vende arroz, frijoles, manteca, productos enlatados, condimentos, churros, pan, cereales, harina, jabón, salvado,  refrescos etc.  Ella ha obtenido varios prestamos con ODEF, el que esta solicitando actualmente es el numero 17 y es por  13,000   Lempiras, este préstamo lo utilizara para surtir de granos básicos,  salvado,  refrescos y otros productos para surtir el negocio.  Su plan es seguir creciendo con el negocio de pulpería.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years old and a single mother of four children. She lives with her children and her grandmother in a neighborhood in the town of Tela, Atlántida.

For the past three years, Cecilia has managed her own grocery business where she sells rice, beans, lard, canned goods, condiments, donuts, bread, grains, flour, soap, bran, soft drinks, and other products. She has obtained several loans from ODEF and the one she is currently requesting is her 17th transaction, which is in the amount of 13,000 HNL. The proceeds will be used to restock her business with basic grains, bran, soft drinks, and other products. Her plan is to continue growing her grocery business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bran, soft drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with four children, and none of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for one year, selling to all categories of people but on a retail basis. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through running a restaurant. She works at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used clothes. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. 

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Dúo Concepcion De Maria Group

texts.es:
Dúo concepción de maría.
El grupo está conformado por las siguientes personas quien es  Hortencia se dedica a la venta de ropa típica (cortes, Güipiles, delante.) desde hace 8 años su venta lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio y los fines de semana  en las aldeas que se encuentran ubicadas alrededor de vista hermosa, por lo mismo necesita otro crédito  para  surtir más en su negocio por que tiene pedidos que le han hecho  sus clientes su deseo es seguir adelante   y poder ser una ayuda económica  y darle  el apoyo en el estudio a sus hijos,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa ripica para la venta.
texts.en: Dúo Concepción de Maria This group includes Hortencia, who has worked for eight years selling traditional items of clothing like cortes [traditional woven skirts], güipiles [traditional woven blouses], and aprons. She sells out of her home and, on weekends, in the villages surrounding Vista Hermosa. Hortencia needs another loan to stock her business because she has orders that her customers have made. Her wish is to keep moving forward and to be able to be an economic help, supporting her children in their studies. She is requesting this loan to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.use: To purchase traditional clothing to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for remodeling of the new bakery, an oven, stove, refrigerator, freezer and supplies.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Ugandan citizen who comes from Rukungiri District. She is aged 28 years. 

Esther currently owns a restaurant in Rukungiri town, where she earns income for her family of one child, and she is expecting another. Before starting her restaurant business thee years ago, their family income had decreased because of the increased standards of living. Esther and her husband agreed to start a business which would lead to the family’s improvement in this area.

Esther has acquired a second loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI). This is to improve her restaurant business by buying food items and better utensils, as well as increasing her household income.

Esther and her husband have managed to save a little of her business profits and they are able to provide themselves with the necessary needs from time to time.

She thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial services but advises to decrease on the loan processing paper work since it calls for bureaucracy.

loans.use: to buy food items and better utensils.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is a farmer from Kaata village in Rukungiri District, Uganda. She lives with her husband and their six children. Together with her elder daughter and her husband, she works hard to sustain the family.

She is acquiring this loan to take her youngest daughters Rebecca and Vivian to attend secondary school at Kinyansano Girls High School in Rukungiri. Jesca tries very much to educate her children so that they get a better education than what she had, but unfortunately it is very difficult for her to pay her daughters’ high school tuition. 

For this reason, Jesca applied for this loan with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) to pay for her daughters’ high school tuition fees. The loan is very important to Jesca because it allows her to give her daughters an opportunity to complete their education.

She therefore thanks the management and staff of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, especially the Rukungiri Branch, for the tremendous work and support toward the education of her children.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her daughters in secondary school.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo is a single mother of five children, and three of her children go to school. She has a business of selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through selling cassava chips and chapatti. She has been in this business for six years and works from her home on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also building her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 38 years old and lives in Montrserrado County where there is the highest production of fish on the Liberian market. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 8 and 21. 

For the past ten years Martha has been selling charcoal in her community. She started this business by selling flour, rice, and sugar for her mother, and is now requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone was born in 1973 at Kabwooma – Nyakagyeme, Rukungiri from a peasantry family. When his parents passed on, he carried on with the parents’ agriculture business of banana planting and livestock to earn a living and support his siblings. Livingstone and his wife have a family of four (4) children of which three attend school.

Livingstone started a salon business in 2010 which serves ladies only at the moment. The business went on getting clients and reached a time when the resources were not enough to serve their clients. In 2012 Livingstone wanted to expand his business and decided to join UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for financial assistance. He got a loan which assisted him to buy more driers and hair oils to meet the demand of his customers, and that increased his income. He decided to come for more money to enhance his salon and to serve more clients, and he intends to open up a section for men using the loan he is is taking now.

Livingstone recommended UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) to continue offering financial assistance to everyone in his community.

loans.use: To buy machines for his barber shop

loans.name: Marthline

texts.en:
Marthline is 38 years old, and lives in Jacob Town, one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. She’s married with four children between 5 to 13 years old that live at home. Her husband is a security guard.  

For the past 10 years Marthline has been involved in the sale of frozen chicken, pig tails, etc. Her main challenge is price increases. She started this business with money from her husband, and will use this loan to purchase more frozen chicken, pig tails, etc to expand her sales. Marthline will use her profits on school fees and house rent. She would like to own a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken, pig tails etc to expand her sales.

loans.name: Jowelia

texts.en:
Jowelia is a single mother, 29 years old, with one child who is five years old and attends school. She operates a small retail shop mainly selling sugar, beans, rice and other household items. She started this business in 2009 and it is located in Muhoro town, on the outskirts of Kagadi town.

Jowelia wants a loan of 800,000/= (eight hundred thousand shillings only) to buy more retail products for selling in her business and to meet the increasing demand. Her dream is to see the business grow so that she is in a position to put up her own residential building and stop renting.

Jowelia is a hard working lady but she faces a challenge of limited capital in the business as well as competition around the area.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to sell

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
Peace group consists of 2 partners both from Dansoman. They are Mary and Peace. They sell silver bowls and biscuits respectively.

Mary is a 38 year old trader. She needs GHC 350 to buy more silver utensils to sell to her customers. Mary has been in this business for the past 5 years and is doing very well. She is very loyal and truthful. She needs this loan to buy more stock to meet her customers’ demands. 

The entire group needs an amount totalling GHS 700 to expand and buy more goods to meet the demand of their respective customers.

loans.use: To buy more silver utensils to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en: Jartu is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Montrserrado County, which has`the highest production of fish on the Liberian market. She stopped her education at grade 5. She is married with four children between 1 and 14 years old, two of whom are attending school. For the past eight years, she has been running a restaurant in the local market. Sometimes it is slow, but most of the times she realizes a profit and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, plates, charcoal, etc for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, plates, charcoal, etc

loans.name: Chrislei

texts.es:
VLa Señora Crhislei, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltera, y cuenta que es dueña de un salón de peluquería con más de 5 años de antigüedad, además de eso también tiene un centro de reciclajes instalado en su domicilio mismo.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, con la visión de salir adelante es que se esfuerza cada dia mas y lo esta logrando. Su meta es seguir creciendo y ayudando a sus familiares,
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de accesorios para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, gel, shampoo, enjuague y demás, ya que con esto puede dar a sus clientes un excelente servicio y calidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Chrislei is from the city of Curuguaty. She is single and has been the owner of a beauty salon for more than five years. Chrislei also operates a recycling center from her home.

She is a hardworking and enterprising person who has the vision to move forward. Through her daily efforts, she has been able to accomplish this. Her goal is to continue growing and helping her relatives.

Chrislei is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, crèmes, gels, shampoo, rinses, and other items. This will allow her to provide her customers with excellent and high-quality service.

loans.use: to buy dyes, crèmes, gels, shampoo, rinses, and other items.

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.ru:
Хикоят трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Первый заем она использовала для приобретения дойной коровы. Она сейчас продолжает свою деятельность. Хикоят обеспечила семью молоком, также она занялась продажей свежего молока. 
В этот раз Хикоят берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки для своей дочери. Она хочет помочь дочери расширить свою деятельность. Ее дочь очень молодая девушка, которая вот уже несколько лет занимается шитьем. Ей необходима финансовая поддержка.
texts.en:
Hikoyat is a hardworking and responsible woman. She used her first loan to buy a milk cow. Right now she conitnues to do her business. Hikoyat has supplied her family with milk and also started to sell fresh milk.

This time Hikoyat is taking a loan to buy a sewing machine for her daughter. She wants to help her daughter expand her business. Her daughter is a young woman who has been sewing for several years. She needs financial support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en: Aidah is a single mother of two children and both her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a restaurant business. She has been in this business for 10 years and works from home seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000/= Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, sweet potatoes and powdered ground nuts. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes, etc

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 43 years old and lives in Montrserrado County, which has the highest production of fish on the Liberian market. She is married and has six children between the ages of 6 and 28 years old. Two of her children live on their own. For the past 12 years, she has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business. She hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the Fuente Para el Desarrollo (Font for Development) 1, 2 & 3. They are micro-businesspeople who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, artisan crafts, etc. They are in the city of Samana, a tourist town in development. Their town is still rural but is a great natural escape, and these borrowers use this to sell their products to people visiting their town.

Juana is a mother of two children. She lives with them in her simple and rural home structure. Juana is very excited to be receiving her fifth loan from Esperanza International. She has successfully paid off her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She started her business almost six years ago. She will invest her new loan in purchasing hair and beauty products as well as other beauty parlor accessories. She runs a beauty salon. She will use her earnings to re-invest in the business while she saves for her children's education and other needs. Juana thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy hair and beauty products

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 20 años, es soltero,  vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Carlos se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Industrial, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Frejoles con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carlos trabaja en la sección abarrotes de una empresa comercial de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Carlos se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea arreglar las paredes, pintar y poner piso a su dormitorio, de esta manera Carlos tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional y administrar una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man who is 20 years of age. He lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. Carlos is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic individual who has the drive to succeed. Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Carlos was able to study for a professional degree in Industrial Engineering. In his free time, he enjoys listening to music. On a few occasions, he will prepare a dish of “frejoles con seco” (beans with stewed meat) to share with his family.

Through his own initiative and with great effort and dedication, Carlos works in the grocery department of a retail company in his city. He begins his work every day in the early morning hours and stays at his job for approximately 10 hours. Carlos enjoys what he does and believes he is doing well because he well-adjusted in his job and treats his customers in a friendly manner.

Carlos is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will be able to make improvements to his home. He wants to repair and paint the walls and also install a floor in his bedroom. This will provide Carlos with better security and well-being. He will continue to work and strive toward his greatest wish of becoming a successful professional and managing a large business.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Azizahan

texts.ru: Азизахон 49 лет,не замужем. Одна воспитала сына. Ему уже 23 года проживает в одном доме с матерью и активно помогает по бизнесу. С 2000 года Азизахон занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начатое с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, где на данный момент есть 20 голов овец, приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от перепродажи скота. Азизахон обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS). Часть доходов от кредита Азизахон планирует увеличить хозяйство путем приобретения дополнительных голов скота.
texts.en: Azizahan is 49 years old, she is not married. She has raised one son. He is now 23 years old and lives in the same house with his mother and is actively helping her in the business. Since 2000 Azizahon has been doing animal husbandry and field crop cultivation. A business which she stated with an amount of 20,000 som (KGS) and at this time has twenty heads of sheep brings in about 15,000 KGS a month from resale of cattle. Azizahan has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som. She plans to use part of the loan to increase the headcount of cattle by buying additional heads of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man aged 42 years with five children. He grew up in a very humble family, which had no assets and even getting tuition to educate him was problematic. He opted to work in the neighbors’ banana (plantain) plantation to earn a living. Due to his hard work, he managed to save some money and bought a piece of land where he put a banana plantation. This enabled him to improve his status to the extent that he even managed to get a wife who is also hard working and developmental. His farming project has been growing until last year when it was affected by banana wilt and drought. 

David is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 to buy organic manure and insecticides to apply into the plantation so as to enable him to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Turdy

texts.ru:
Турди женщина с тонким чувством юмора. Она трудолюбивая и активная женщина в жизни. У Турди трудное условие жизни, так как ее муж не везучий человек и поэтому он не имеет хорошую и высокооплачиваемую работу. Турди всегда приходится взять семейный расход на себя. Ее дети попросили ее найти новый источник дохода, так как еда, учеба, интернет и т.п. требуют массу денег. Турди окончательно решила организовать свой бизнес, купле продажей сухофруктов. Она считает, что этот бизнес весьма благополучный, так как сухофрукты имеют большой спрос на местном рынке. Она вместе  своей соседкой обратилась Ассоциация Деловых Женщин, чтобы участвовать на курсе «Добейся успеха».  От данного курса она получила много информации и теперь у нее есть навыки в сфере бизнеса, но нет денег, чтобы организовать бизнес. 
Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Этот займ поможет ей улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Turdy is a woman with a good sense of humor. She is a hardworking and active woman in life. Turdy has hardship in life because her husband is not a very lucky man and does not have a good high paying job. Turdy has to always take care of family expenses herself. Her children asked her to find a new source of income because food, school, internet and other expenses demand a lot of money. Turdy has finally decided to start her own business by buying dry fruit. She thinks that this is a very good business because dry fruits have a high demand on the local market. Together with her neighbor she has come to the Association of Business Women to take part in the Achieve Success course. She has received a lot of information from this course and now has new skills in the field of business, but does not have capital to start the business.

Turdy is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni to buy goods to start her new business. This loan will help her improve her living conditions. She is looking forward to your kindness.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit to start a new business.

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Johana habita en la ciudad de Managua, es acompañada y tiene dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar.

Doña Johana anteriormente se dedicaba a atender un pequeño cafetín en una escuela que queda en  las cercanías de su casa de habitación, pero luego de tener problemas con el incremento de la renta en la casa que habita tubo que buscar otra forma de incrementar su ingresos, fue por tal  razón que decide dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada ya que tiene precios mas bajos y las personas adquieren con mas frecuencia.

 Un día típico de doña Johana da inicia a las 9 de la mañana, saca la ropa en el porche de su casa, atiende a sus clientes durante todo el día y guarda su mercadería a eso de las nueve de la noche.

Esta solicitando un crédito  a ceprodel y kiva para poder comprar más pacas de ropa y tener mayor variedad que ofrecerles a sus clientes, con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y poder llevar mayores ingresos a su hogar en beneficio  de su familia. Y su su clientela al venderles mejores prendas de ropa.
texts.en:
Johana lives in the city of Managua with her common-law husband and two small school-aged children.

Johana used to work at a coffee shop outside the school near her home, but then experienced problems with the rent increase on her house, meaning she had to increase her income.  That is why she decided to sell used clothing because of its low price and the fact that people buy it more frequently.

On a typical work day Johana begins at 9:00 a.m. by taking the clothing out on her porch.  She spends all day attending to customers and puts away the merchandise at around 9:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan through Ceprodel and Kiva to buy more packs of clothing so she can offer a wider variety to customers.  Her goal is to improve her lifestyle and increase her household earnings for the benefit of the family.  She also wants to sell better clothing to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a pack of used clothing.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 25 years old and lives in the Jacob town area, which is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. She’s married with three children between four and ten years old. They live at home with her and are in school. She has been involved with the sale of used clothes for the past five years. She started this business with help from her husband who gave her some money years ago. Her main challenge is to send her children to school and take care of her home. 

Mercy has requested this loan to purchase more used clothes to resell.  She hopes to build her own house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Los Vecinos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS VECINOS está compuesto por nueve integrantes, todas mujeres, la presidenta del banco es La Sra. Margoth tiene 21 años, no es casada pero convive con su pareja,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, ella es   Panadera desde hace 2 años, su panadería se encuentra en la localidad de Cabezas este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución el anterior crédito lo utilizo para su negocio, La Sra. Margoth utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, levadura y manteca para la elaboración de pan su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de insumos por mayor ya que es más barato comprar por cantidad, La Sra. Margoth enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener más clientela y así de esta manera generar más ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en brindar  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
The entrepreneur bank called LOS VECINOS is comprised of nine members, all women.  The president of the group is Margoth, 21, who lives with her common-law husband.  She makes and sells bread for a living.  She has been running a bakery for two years in the town of Cabezas.  This is her second loan through the institution and the previous loan was used for her business.

Margoth will use the loan to buy ingredients such as flour, yeast and shortening to make bread.  She plans to buy the goods wholesale, making them cheaper.  The challenges Margoth is up against are: increasing her customer base and generating more income.  She will use the profit to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour to make bread.

loans.name: Fany Neli

texts.es:
Fany es una mujer de 34 años, creció en un hogar del campo con escasos recursos económicos, pero en el cual sus padres le apoyaron para estudiar la escuela primaria, conocimientos con los cuales  ha trabajado a lo largo de su vida, decidió salir de su casa para vivir con su pareja Alfredo con quien tiene 3 hijos de 10 años el mayor, 7 años el segundo que están estudiando en una escuela pública y la más pequeña de 7 meses.  Una familia agricultora que viven en una parroquia rural de la ciudad de Quito capital de la provincia del Ecuador, su nombre es Nanegalito, parroquia ubicada al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha, que fue residencia de una cultura ecuatoriana. Es un lugar poseedor de diversidad de flora y fauna y además ríos y cascadas que son una fuente cristalina que atrae turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Un medio de producción de la zona es la ganadería con la producción de leche y carne y también la agricultura con la producción de caña de azúcar, yuca, caña, maíz, naranjas, mandarinas y papayas. Las artesanías elaboradas a mano también son una oportunidad de negocio en el lugar, que son demandadas por el uso particular de materiales naturales como semillas del bosque. Por todo esto las autoridades locales se han preocupado por hacer instalaciones adecuadas para que todos sus más de 3000 habitantes tengan acceso a los servicios básicos a pesar de que fue una zona que en el pasado no fue muy tomada en cuenta.
Fany desde hace un año se dedica a la crianza de pollos y gallinas para su posterior comercialización y además la producción de huevos. Fany no se dejó vencer de los obstáculos a pesar de que en un emprendimiento anterior, tuvo una pérdida muy significativa de recursos económicos. Ahora paralelamente a los quehaceres de su hogar se dedica 8 horas cada día a alimentar sus animales, limpiar los criaderos, vender los pollos, etc. A Fany le es muy difícil conseguir recursos cuando se ha quedado sin alimento para sus aves y para no sufrir este temor ha solicitado un préstamo que lo utilizará en la compra de balanceado al por mayor para así suplir las necesidades alimenticias de sus aves por algunos meses y además comprar más aves que le permitan incrementar su negocio y sus clientes. Fany sueña con tener junto a su familia una calidad de vida superior a la que ella tuvo y que sus hijos puedan educarse hasta conseguir una profesión que los lleve lejos. Esta mujer sin duda esforzada, agradece a todos quienes alrededor del mundo aportan con un granito de arena para su crecimiento personal y por supuesto agradece a Fundación Alternativa que con el apoyo de Kiva le ha podido brindar la facilidad de obtener este capital.
texts.en:
Fany, 34, grew up in a country home with scarce economic resources, but with the help of her parents she was able to get an elementary education which has helped her through work all her life.  She moved away from home with her common-law husband, Alfredo, and they have three children, a 10-year-old, a 7-year-old and a baby girl, 7 months old.  They are a farming family and live in a rural community called Nanegalito in Quito, Ecuador.  The town is located northwest of the province of Pichincha, the residence of an Ecuadorean culture.  It is a place with a diversity of flora and fauna and pristine rivers and waterfalls that attract national and foreign tourists.  One of the main business activities in the area is farming, including milk and meat production, as well as crop farming of sugar cane, yucca plant, corn, oranges, tangerines and papayas.  Artisan handicrafts are also important here and in much demand because of their natural materials such as forest seeds.  All of this has motivated the local authorities to install adequate facilities so the more than 3,000 inhabitants can have access to basic services despite the fact that the area was never given consideration in the past.

For a year now, Fany has been raising chickens and hens that she later sells, along with eggs.  Fany never has let obstacles get in her way, despite the fact that in her pervious business she suffered a significant economic loss.  Now, in addition to her household chores, she spends eight hours a day feeding the animals, cleaning their pens, selling chicken, etc.  

It is very difficult for Fany to obtain resources when she runs out of animal feed, so in order not to run the risk she is requesting a loan to buy wholesale balanced feed to have enough on hand for a few months.  She will also buy more chicken to increase business and her customer base.  

Fany's goal is to give her family a better quality of life than her own.  She wants her children to get an education so they can become successful professionals.  This hard-working woman is grateful to people around the world who contribute toward her personal growth.  Of course, she is algo grateful to Fundación Alternativa which, with Kiva's support, has made the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Sah

texts.en: Sah is 29 years old and lives in Jacob Town.  This is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County since is close to the biggest market in Liberia. She is single with three children between the ages of 3 and 12, which are attending school, and live at home. Her boyfriend is a businessman. For the past 5 years she has been selling biscuits, candy, rice, pepper, coal and oil in the community market.  She makes more profit during different periods, but mostly of the time business is slow. She is requesting a loan to increase her stocks of biscuits, candy, rice, pepper, coal and oil for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, candy, rice, pepper, coal and oil to increase the stock for her market.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in Jacob Town. She is 35 years old, married with two children age 8 and 14 years old.  They are in school and live at home.  For the past four years she has been selling charcoal in her community. She started this business from her savings, and she enjoys the independence.  She says sometimes business is slow.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana is 28 years old, and lives in Jacob Town.  It is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County.  She’s single with a two year old child that lives at home with her. Joana has been involved in the sales of slippers for past 4 years. She says there is increased buying during the rainy season. She started this business with the help of her boyfriend who gave her some money. Her main goal is to send her child to school and take care of her home. Joana has requested this loan to purchase more slippers to resell. She hopes to build her own house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to resell.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchando Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se encuentra en su octavo ciclo, están trabajando arduamente para poder seguir creciendo y dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para poder tener una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Norma, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todas las variedades, es muy talentosa con sus comidas y por eso ya se hizo de muy buena clientela. Con estos ingresos cubre los gastos diarios de la casa, y está saliendo adelante.
Cuenta la Sra. Norma que solicita de este crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, harina, huevos, y demás, para poder seguir haciendo sus comestibles y luchar por su familia.
texts.en:
This group is in its eighth loan cycle and the members are working hard to continue growing their businesses and giving their families everything they can for a decent lifestyle.

One of the members of the group is Norma.  She sells all kinds of food and is a very talented cook, so she has a good customers base.  With her income she is able to cover the daily household expenses, so she is getting ahead.

Norma says she is requesting the loan to buy meat, condiments, flour, eggs and other goods so she can continue with her food business and help her family.

loans.use: To buy meat, condiments, flour, eggs and other goods.

loans.name: Deisy Noemy

texts.es: Deisy Nohemy vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijo en casa propia; ella posee una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, especias, producto instantáneo entre otros,  tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de experiencia valiosa en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, ya posee mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio excelente; Deisy es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor  y con muchos sueños por delante, quiere un futuro mejor y todos los días se esfuerza con amor y constancia porque sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito que tanto desea, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, pan, especies, etc. Deisy Nohemy tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable se siente muy agradecida con la ayuda y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Deisy Nohemy lives with her common-law husband and two children in their own house.  She has a small grocery store where she sells basic items, staple goods, spices, instant products and other merchandise.  She has been in business for several years; and her sales experience has allowed her to improve her income.  She has many customers who prefer her quality, low prices and excellent service.

Deisy is an entrepreneur who is dedicated to her work and has many goals.  She wants a better future, and every day she works hard with love and consistency because she knows that is the only way to become successful.  Over the past few weeks, there has been an increase in demand and she wants to take advantage of the moment to make a new investment.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to be able to buy staple goods, instant products, bread, spices, etc.

Deisy Nohemy has a good credit record.  She is very responsible and grateful for the help, and committed to paying it back on time.  She hopes to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy staple goods, instant products, bread and spices.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza is married with two children, both who go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan. 

Specioza works from her home six days of the week but on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to go to the village of Masaka for bunches of green bananas and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is married with four children. All her children go to school. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent. 

She earns a living by selling used shoes and has been in this business for five years. She also generates additional income by selling used ladies bags. She works in the market five days a week and sells retail only. 

She is requesting a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes.

Her main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to start importing used shoes and to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with five children and three of her children go to school. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothing. She works five days out of every week. She goes door to door selling used clothes and sells on a retail basis only. She generates additional income from renting rooms. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which hinders her movements. She aspires to get a permanent business premise and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 43 years old lives in the Jacob Town area.  She’s married with1 child, age five, who lives at home. Her husband is a driver. For the past 20 years she has been involved in the sales of used clothing. Her main challenge is the increase in prices. She started this business with money from her husband. She will use the money to purchase more used clothing to resell. In future she would like to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Kubo

texts.en:
Kubo is 43 years old and lives in Jacob Town, which is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. She is married and has two children aged seven and nine. Only one of them lives with her, but both of them attend school.

Kubo has been involved in the sale of frozen food like fish, chicken, and pig's feet since 2002. She started this business with the help of her mother who gave her the money to start. She is proud of being able to earn her own money.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more frozen food like fish, chicken and pig's feet for resale. In the future, she plans to build her children a house.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen food like fish, chicken and pig's feet for resale

loans.name: Panambi Group

texts.es:
Panambi tiene 12 mujeres como integrantes, están en su octavo ciclo y siguen trabajando y luchando para poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Odilia,  ella se dedica hace varios años a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante. Y con este trabajo ha ido creciendo y dando a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Cuenta la Sra. Odilia que solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo, ya que siempre la destaca que tiene de todo y quiere poder seguir así para dar una buena variedad a sus clientes y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Panambi is composed of twelve women who are in their eighth cycle, and continue to work hard in order to reach the highest level in the program.

One of the group’s members is Mrs. Odilia, who has been selling clothes as a street vendor for several years now. With this job, she has been able to grow and give her family everything they need to have a decent life without privation.

Mrs. Odilia says that she is requesting a loan to invest in buying all kinds of garments. She stands out because she always has a good assortment and she wants to continue doing so in order to offer her customers a wide variety and be able to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Sanyu

texts.en:
Sanyu is married with two children, one of which goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and feeding the family.

She has a canteen and has been in this business for three years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She sells on retail and works six days a week. 

She is requesting a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baking flour, cooking oil, sweets, biscuits, cakes, bread buns, books and pens.

Her main business challenges are the rainy season, because she works in a muddy place, and thieves. She aspires to own a wholesale shop and to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more baking flour, biscuits, cakes, bread buns, books and pens

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Elene and her group have paid back their loan and are requesting a new one to continuing growing their businesses. This past loan had a great impact on their businesses and lives, especially Elene which is receiving her 9th loan to increase her business inventory by expanding her product options and her clientele.

As a widow mother she is working hard to provide her children all they need as poor people, wanting them to grow up and with the best education they can have. She is saving her business profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old married man. For the past three years, Mohammad has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family, but it needs more support to cover the costs.
Mohammad is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, canned foods, sugar and milk. This will increase sales and increase Mohammad's income.
Mohammad is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase needed stock of basic groceries to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 39-year-old married man and father of three children. He has been working in a coffee shop for two years to make his living and cover his family's expenses.
Hassan is a hardworking man, he puts so much effort into improving his family's living and developing his business.
Hassan used to work as an employee in a gas company, but he thought of starting his own business to increase his income.
This is Hassan's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower.  His previous loans helped him a lot in developing his new business.
Today his present loan will be invested in his business too, he will increase his business merchandise and replace his espresso machine by buying a new upgraded one.
He hopes to keep on expanding his business and to open another coffee shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise and replace his espresso maching with an upgraded one.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo in his store.

Amneh is a 52-year-old married woman. She is a mother to one son and one daughter, and lives with her family in Gaza city.

For the past ten years, Amneh's husband has been selling different types of herbs that customers often use to treat seasonal diseases such as colds, pneumonia, coughs, abdominal pains and stomach problems. This project has been a profitable one and the only source of income for the family, but from time to time it needs more support to cover the cost.

Amneh is requesting a USD Murabaha loan to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing more types of herbs.
This will increase sales and increase the family's income positively.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase herbs that customers often request and buy.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Todas las integrantes del comité superaron el nivel 3 del indicadores de pobreza, gracias al acompañamiento constante en sus actividades, ya todas se encuentran en semáforo verde y han mejorado bastante.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Manuela, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar. Se dedica a la venta de leche y cuenta que empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del dia para poder dar a sus clientes los productos más frescos. Por medio de su trabajo pudo salir adelante y quiere seguir haciéndolo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de leche, ya que con esto podrá aumentar su stock y seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes y eso le ayudará a mejorar su plan de trabajo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Madres Unidas" (United Mothers, in English) and is on its seventh loan cycle.  In this program of committees of mothers everybody works and tries to move forward.  All the members of the committee are above level three on the poverty scale, thanks to having constant help in their work.  All are now in the green area and have improved greatly.

One of the women is Manuela, who is a very hard-working person with a lot of desire to move ahead and progress.  She makes a living selling milk and starts work very early in the morning in order to provide her customers with the freshest products.  Through her work she has gotten ahead and she wants to continue this.

She is applying for this loan to buy milk as with it she can increase her stock and continue providing a good service to her customers.  This will help her to improve her working plan.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo in his store.
Eman is a 30-year-old married young woman; she is a mother to two sons and three daughters.  The family lives in the Beit Lahia district in Jabalia and lead a modest simple life.
For the past three years, Eman's husband has been selling computers, laptops and accessories, and it has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family, but it needs more support to cover some necessary costs.
Eman is requesting a 1,500 USD Youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing additional computers and a new collection of accessories. Receiving this loan will enable Eman's husband to enhance his store with new types of computers and a new collection of accessories that are requested by customers. This will increase sales and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase computers and accessories that have been requested by customers.

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo next to his taxi.
Wafa is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother to three sons and two daughters.
For the past four years, Wafa's husband has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family, but from time to time it needs support to cover the costs.
Wafa is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing new engine for the taxi he drives and making some necessary repairs such as painting. This will increase the taxi capacity to work extra hours and enable Wafa's husband to take additional requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: to paint the taxi and purchase a new engine.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old single young man. Mohammad is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Mohammad to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Mohammad and improve the family's living conditions. Mohammad is photographed at the store where he purchased the laptop.

loans.use: to purchase new laptop for his university studies.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 7 children and has been farming for 17 years. Her primary income sources are milk, and crops. She will use the loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.

She stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is milking the cows to get milk for sale and for the family's consumption! Her biggest challenge is when the animals go dry, there's no earning from it, and one has to find an alternative source of income. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Chemulgo.'

Milka was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, and she replied that she knew about Juhudi from Juhudi's marketing team. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session.  She learned how to acquire assets through credit, earn from the assets and be able to repay the loan and develop her business.
Her highest monthly expenses are family expenses. When asked how this loan benefit your family?, Milka replied that we hope to increase production and thus more income.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Milka owns the following: a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower does not have 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.
