Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow to increse milk production on her farm.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité tiene 13 integrantes, en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la que se dedican, por mas pequeña que esta sea. Todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con ansias de trabajar y salir adelante por medio del esfuerzo de todas.
Emilce, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, ella misma cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que con esto muchas veces no le alcanza, pero pese a ello lucha por salir adelante y seguir ayudando a su familia. Esta orgullosa con lo que hace ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar remedios naturales y con ellos poder seguir con su trabajo y tener los medios para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
This group has thirteen hardworking members that like to work in order to get ahead in life through their effort. They all have their own lines of work even if they are small businesses.

Emilce, one of the members, sells natural medicines. She says that it is a hard job and that sometimes she does not make enough for a living. However, she fights to get ahead and keep helping her family. She is proud of her business, since it is a decent and honest activity.

Emilce is requesting a loan to buy natural medicines and continue with her business, in order to be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicinal herbs to sell.

loans.name: Yvapoo Poty Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a que una de las miembros, quien invito a sus amigas y vecinas para formar parte de este desafío. Actualmente son 14 mujeres, y cada una de ellas lucha sin parar para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Wilma, quien por medio de la venta de comestibles tiene los medios para seguir ayudando a su familia. Ella se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que quiere seguir esforzándose para ayudar a los suyos seguir apoyándolos así.
Wilma solicita de este crédito para poder comprar harina, huevos, carne, aceite, verduras, entre otros productos para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende. Agradece por la ayuda que están recibiendo, ya que se benefician, no solo las integrantes del grupo, sino también sus familias.
texts.en:
This committee came together thanks to one of its members, who invited female friends and neighbours to become a part of this challenge.  There are currently 14 women in the group and each one never stops fighting to help their families.

One of the women is Wilma who, by selling groceries, now has the means to continue to help her family.  She defines herself as being very hard-working and feisty.  She wants to continue making a strong effort to help her family and continue supporting them.  

Wilma is applying for this loan to buy flour, eggs, meat, oil, vegetables and other products so as to continue selling groceries.  She is thankful for the help she is receiving as it does not just help the group members but also their families.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, meat, oil, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Lamia

texts.en:
Lamia is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.  This is the picture in his newly opened store.

Lamia is a 22-year-old married young woman.  She is a housewife and lives with her husband in simple living conditions.  Lamia's husband wants to start a new project which is a store for selling computers, so Lamia wants to work with her husband to cover some necessary costs to enhance the project.  Lamia is requesting a 3,000 USD startup loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing computers to sell.  Taking this loan will enable Lamia's husband to start his project successfully and attract customers to buy, which will increase their income and offer them better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase computers for sale

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 19-year-old single young man.  He is a taxi driver and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover his needs.  

Shadi also is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Shadi do his homework and reports and help him in his studies.  This will ensure a better future for Shadi and improve the family's living conditions. Shadi is photographed at the store where he is purchasing the laptop.

loans.use: To buy new laptop

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is a 38-year-old married man and the father of two children.  He is a hard working Palestinian man, who puts in a lot of effort to provide his family with the best living ever.  Issam has managed two businesses for 17 years.  He owns a shoes and bag selling shop, and at the same time he is an expert plumber, but since the plumbing business doesn't generate a good income, he puts a lot of effort into supporting the shoe business because it generates a good income.  

But unfortunately this business isn't good enough for him to increase its income automatically and that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his shoes collection with the new spring-summer collection.  Issam hopes to keep on expanding his business more and more to provide his family with the best living ever and he wants to make sure that they will have a brighter future.

loans.use: To increase his shoe collection with the new spring-summer collection

loans.name: Rabecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners.  She has 2 children and has been doing this work for 3 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and the salary from a  job.  She will use the loan facility to buy and insure a dairy cow.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming:  'Feeding my cows!'  Her biggest challenge is 'Pest control.'  The animal on the farm have been given the name of 'Chaboit.'

Rebecca was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'They have agricultural products.'   This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session:  'Record keeping.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Rebecca replied 'I can get more milk to feed my family.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated.  Rebecca owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.  This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV, DVD', but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reduces paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old married young man.  He is a Municipal employee who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs.

Mohammad wants to improve his house living conditions, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting the house and installing new lights.  Taking this loan will help Mohammad improve the living conditions so he can enjoy living in their house with his family.  Mohammad is photographed in his house.

loans.use: To paint the house and install new lights

loans.name: Thouraya

texts.en:
Thouraya is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of two children.  She has been working in selling clothes since 2003. 

Thouraya is a brave wife and she insisted on starting her own business to help her husband in covering their family's expanses and raise their children with a good and healthy living.  Thouraya's business needs external support to increase her merchandise and that's why she applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new spring-summer collection.  She also sells gifts and accessories.  She is well known in the region,with her good reputation and manners.  She hopes that one day she will expand her business more and open a larger shop that will sure attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy new spring-summer collection

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim is a 35-year-old married man who has been working in selling clothes for 11 years.  In 2011, Karim decided to start his own business since he has a long experience in this field and has a large network of customers. 

His work is going on just fine covering its expenses and some of his social life needs since his wife supports their income and living needs.
Today Karim is applying for his third loan cycle from Al Majmoua kiva's partner, and he is sure that it will have an excellent effect on his business as the previous one did.  He will also use part of the loan to buy necessary home needs.  He will work hard on pleasing his customers as much as he can, because he is sure that they are the key to his success.

loans.use: To buy new spring-summer collection

loans.name: Abdelkareem

texts.en:
AbdelKareem is a 27-year-old single young man.  He is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover his needs and pay the education expenses. 

AbdelKareem is studying at the university, specializing in Arts.  AbdelKareem wants to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the university fees.  This will ensure a better future for AbdelKareem and improve his living conditions.  AbdelKareem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the university fees

loans.name: Aseel 1 Group

texts.en:
Rania is the featured borrower of Aseel 1 group and she is seated on the right.  She came along with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Rania is a 37-year-old single woman who has been working in making souvenirs and decorating chocolates for eight years to make her living.  She also works at a school and she is responsible for taking care of a few children to make a better living and to make sure that she has a fixed monthly income. Today Rania wants to support her own business by applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to  increase her business requested items, such as stands, beads and decorative items.  She hopes that the future will be brighter and she will be capable of opening her own souvenir shop.

Sonia is the one at the left.  She is a 38-year-old married woman and mother of three children.  She has worked as a tailor for ten years to help her husband pay for their children's educational fees to make sure they get the best education ever.  With this loan, she will buy an oven that she needs a lot at home.  She hopes to open a laundry in the future to increase her income.

Zeinab is a 22-year-old married woman, who has been working as a sales woman in a convenience store for 2 years.  With this loan she will be capable of preparing necessary baby needs for her expected soon baby.  She is the one seated in the middle.

loans.use: To increase her business requested items, such as stands, beads and decorative items

loans.name: Yoland

texts.en: Yoland  is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business.  She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family.  She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as sleepers, cigarettes, milk, banana cream, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $250.  Yoland is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy Banana cream, milk, coca cola, fanta and sprite.

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en: Joaninha is a 35-year-old married woman who runs a kiosk to generate income for her family. She wanted to create a bigger business but did not have enough working capital. However, she has been feeling better since she applied for her first loan with Tuba Rai Metin (TRM) and she is now applying for her second loan of $1,000 USD. With this money, she will buy some additional supplies for her store such as soft drinks, oil, milk and biscuits. She is happy that TRM offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy oil, milk, biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Angeles works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling rice and from her general store. Angeles is borrowing 29000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luz is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Luz has a food vending business in the Philippines. Luz requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Luz has been in this business for six years. In the future, Luz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is 52 years old. She is married and has two children. Cesaria works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, drinks, canned goods, rice and other groceries, in her general store. She also earns additional income from from raising pigs and farming rice.
Cesaria has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items.. 

Cesaria successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. In the future, Cesaria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, drinks, canned goods, rice and other groceries, in her general store

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 54 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Perlita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Perlita has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Evangeline is borrowing 19000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal for her charcoal business to sell.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Marialyn has been in this business for 15 years now.

Marialyn requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

In the future, Marialyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ndeye Niamass

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye  Niamass  vit au Sénégal avec sa famille. Elle est mariée et exerce l’activité de commerce depuis plus de 6 ans dans le but de vouloir soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Elle vend  des tissus plus spécialement des tissus teintés et du karité. Elle est un membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle a déjà obtenu un prêt déjà soldé. Elle sollicite un nouveau prêt d’un montant de 200.000 francs  CFA dans le but d’acheter des tissus pour son commerce. Ce crédit peut lui permettre assurément d’augmenter son fond de roulement et ses bénéfices. Ainsi, elle pourra satisfaire davantage la demande de sa clientèle. Elle projette dans le futur de développer son activité de commerce et devenir une grande commerçante  de renommée.
texts.en: Ndeye Niamass lives in Senegal with her family. She is married and has been a retailer for over 6 years, with the aim of helping her husband to manage the daily expenses. She sells fabrics, more specifically dyed fabrics, and shea butter. She is a member of a UIMCEC branch, where she has previously received a loan which she has already settled. She is requesting a new loan of 200 000 francs in order to buy fabrics for her business. This loan will undoubtedly allow her to increase her business and her profits; therefore she will also be able to better satisfy her customers. She plans to develop her business and become a large, leading retailer.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabrics and shea butter for resale.

loans.name: Joreta

texts.en:
This is Joreta; she is 34-years old and a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Gerardo, a worker, and is the mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Joreta maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products including popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  

Joreta dreams to see her business growing and hopes to have their own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Lyndon

texts.en:
Lyndon is married with three children. He is 45 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba.

To earn a living, Lyndon has a motorcycle transport business. He has had this business for seven years. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 3,000. Lyndon has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: To pay for his child's tuition fees

loans.name: Asri Lestari Group

texts.en:
This is the six loan for Asri Lestari group. All of the member were able to attend the meeting. They took out a new loan to continue their businesses. Although last period their pigs didn't get a good price, they still keep their spirit to run this business. They hope this period will be better. The vet suggested to them to give more nutritious feed and vitamins. 

Ni Nyoman needs a larger new loan to purchase two superior piglets, vitamins and feed. She hopes she can earn more profit this time and all will be put toward savings.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets, vitamins and feed

loans.name: Ndeye Walimata

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Walimata  habite au Sénégal. C’est une femme mariée qui exerce l’activité de commerce depuis 10 ans dans le but d’assister son mari dans la gestion de la nourriture d’une famille de 5 enfants. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de tissus..  . Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle a déjà   remboursé  un  prêt  antérieur.  Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit d’un montant de 500.000 francs CFA en vue d’acheter des tissus destinés à la revente. Ce crédit peut accroitre ses ressources financières de telles sortes qu’elle puisse augmenter renforcer sa participation dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes. Elle souhaite disposer d’un grand magasin de vente de tissus dans le futur.
texts.en: Ndeye Walimata lives in Senegal. She is a married woman and has been a retailer for over 10 years, in order to help her husband cover the food needs of a family with 5 children. She specialises in the sale of fabrics. She is a member of a UIMCEC branch where she has already repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a new loan of 500 000 francs with which to buy fabrics for resale. This loan could increase her financial resources to an extent where she is able to increase her contribution to the daily expenses. She would one day like to own a large shop selling fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: 01.01.01 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân has a retail business selling shoes and sandals. She is requesting a loan to purchase footwear to resell. Xuân is 61 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 01.01.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent, another child is an adult. 

In 2008, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xuân has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuân has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her business to do well, her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Lusila

texts.en:
Lusila is a 62-year-old woman who is married and has four children.She has a small business, selling Samoan coco in her community. She has four years with this business.Lusila needs a loan to purchase more Samoan cocoa and equipment to expand her business. She will use her profits to save for her kids' educations.
Lusila joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy more Samoan coco and equipment to expand her business, such as plastic bags, foam cups, a wheelbarrow and shovels.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 47 years old and has three school-aged children. He aims to improve his farming business and generate sufficient income to satisfy his family needs and continue sending his children to school. Due to the high cost of school fees, he also engages in hog-raising to earn additional income. 

Alfredo planned to raise more pigs to sell but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of P 30,000  to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Despite the hardships in farming he has the determination to uplift their standard of living. He is hoping that someday, he will become successful and financially stable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
This is Cristina. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stock of frozen food. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of processed foods and frozen foods like hot dogs, ham, stuffed meat, chicken and other products. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cristina dreams of being successful in her business and  able to put aside more savings. She hopes that her family will always be happy and in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of processed foods and frozen foods like hot dogs, ham, stuffed meat, chicken and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Mujeres Y Hombres Emprendedores 1, 2  & 3 Group

texts.en:
Lucrecia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres y Hombres emprendedores (Entrepreneur women and men 1, 2 & 3). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband, and they have 10 children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to raise her children and give them a good education. She enjoys serving other in her church and community.

This is Lucrecia's second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and growing her business. She has been running her business for around nine years, after she decided to run a small business from her house. She started selling groceries and now, she is running a 'colmado' (small food market). This loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, eggs, rice, beans and other goods. She will use the profit to reinvest in her business. She is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to  buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, canned food, etc

loans.name: Urumuli (Rbv) Group

texts.fr:
Beathe fait partie du groupe solidaire URUMULI (Rbv) qui fait l’agriculture des maïs. Elle marié, âgé de 32 ans et a 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 8 ans et le moins âgé a 3 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge. Elle est née au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de l’éducation primaire.
Elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2012 et est au 4ème cycle de crédit. Les cycles antérieurs sont bien remboursés.
Avec le présent crédit, elle va louer le champ, acheter la semence et payer la main d’œuvre. Elle n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Pour accroitre son agriculture, elle a la stratégie de pratiquer l’agriculture moderne et va chercher les marchés de sa récolte aux écoles secondaires.
L’ambition pour son activité agricole est d’acheter son propre champ. Pour sa famille, elle va éduquer ses enfants jusqu’à l’université et continuera d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Beathe is a member of the Urumuli (Rbv) group, which grows corn. She is 32 years old, married and the mother of 4 children, the eldest of whom is 8 years old and the youngest, 3. Three of her children go to school and she is responsible for no other people. She was born in Rwanda and has 6 years of primary level education. She started to work with ACB Ltd in 2012 and is on her 4th loan cycle. The previous loans have been properly reimbursed. 

She will use her current loan to rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers. She does not expect to have any difficulties in repaying this loan. Her strategy is to use modern farming methods in order to increase her agricultural productivity, and she will look for markets for her produce in secondary schools. Her business aim is to buy her own field. Concerning her family, she will make sure her children are educated to university level and she will continue to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Leonito

texts.en: Leonito is 34 years old, and is married to Jinky. They live in the village where he generates income. Leonito is engaged in the hog-raising business. He has been in this business for three years and earns PHP 2,500 per piglet. Right now, Leonito is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs. He believes that he can improve his business through the help of his loan.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs

loans.name: 01.02.04 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Bê is applying for a loan to purchase food to make soup. She operates a food stall/restaurant. Bê is 49 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 01.02.04 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2011, Bê joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bê has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bê has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Bê faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bê hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase food to make soup at her food stall.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros; she is 40 years old and is a resident of Batasan, Commonwealth, Philippines. She is married to Floro and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Milagros operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Milagros dreams for the continued success of her business and hopes for a good life. She meets her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her retail business.

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.fr:
Jean Clayde fait partie du groupe solidaire TWISUNGANE qui fait l’agriculture des maïs. Il  marié, âgé de 27 ans et a 2 enfants dont le plus âgé a 4 ans et le moins âgé a 2 ans. Aucun de ses enfants ne va  à l’école et deux autres personnes sont en sa charge. Il est né au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 5 ans de l’éducation primaire.
Elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2008 et est au 3ème cycle de crédit. Les cycles antérieurs sont bien remboursés.
Avec le présent crédit, il va louer le champ, acheter la semence et payer la main d’œuvre. Il n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Pour accroitre son agriculture, il a la stratégie de pratiquer l’agriculture moderne en utilisant les engrais chimiques.
L’ambition pour son activité agricole est de devenir l’agriculteur professionnel. Pour sa famille, il va construire sa propre maison et continuera d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Claude is part of the Twisungane solidarity group which grows corn. He is 27 years old, married and has 2 children, the eldest of whom is 4 years old and the youngest, 2. Neither of his children go to school and he is also responsible for 2 other people. He was born in Rwanda and has 5 years of primary school education. He started working with ACB Ltd in 2008 and is on his 3rd loan cycle. The previous loans have been properly reimbursed.

He will use the current loan to rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers. He does not expect to have any difficulty in repaying this loan. In order to increase his agricultural output, his strategy is to use modern farming methods, namely chemical fertilizers. His business ambition is to become a professional farmer. As to his family, he will build his own house and will continue ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: to rent a field, pay the labourers and buy seeds.

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en: Daya Pertiwi Group got a loan for the 8th time; the number of members totals 15, and the total loan is for 30M IDR. Having been successful with pig fattening, Dewa Ayu will use this loan to purchase four types of local pigs for pork roll; the pigs will be maintained for two months. The remainder of the loan will be used to fix the cage for the preparation of a new birth from the sow that she already owns. The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about this business going forward. With all the benefits she receives, she plans to repair the home and also save for the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase four types of local pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en: Clarisa is 21 years old. She is married and and has a child. The famiy lives at Gosi. Her spouse is providing motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. To supplement her spouse's income, she raises hogs to sell for a profit. She had been in her business for two years. She hopes to raise healthy hogs and earn more income but has insufficient funds now. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of P 6,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs' sustainability. She hopes to keep improving her sales and become successful in her business and secure a good future for their child.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs' sustainability

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a retail store owner who lives at Gosi with her spouse and child. She had been selling grocery items to the people in her village. She usually earns about P 7,000 each month and uses it for the family's sustenance, for meals and bills at home. She would like to increase her sales and income as well and that is why she is asking for a loan of P 8,000 to invest in buying more merchandise to sell. She will buy sardines, eggs, bread, coffee and sugar to sell in her store. 

Virginia will continously extend good products and services to all her customers in order to increase profits and save funds for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, bread, coffee and sugar to sell in her store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
This is Sonia. She previously received a 28,000 PHP loan that she used for the repair and maintenance of her apartment units. Her earnings were a big help to her personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells rice for additional income.

She would like to request another 20,000 PHP loan for the repair and maintenance of her apartment units. She will also use the money to buy sacks of rice. The profits from her business will definitely help her meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sonia hopes that her businesses will continue to grow. She is also looking forward to have more sources of income. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her apartment units and to buy sacks of rice

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 47, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay City, Philippines. She is a mother to her children and, with the help of her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Susan operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Susan hopes to have more customers and dreams of giving her children a good life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial, 31 years old and single, raises hogs in Gosi, selling them when they attain the desired weight. Usually earning about P2,000 for each one sold, he hopes to ensure the healthy growth of his hogs and so is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy hog feed and medicines for them.

In the future, Marcial hopes to keep gaining good profits from his business to attain financial independence.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines to sustain his hogs.

loans.name: Tugirubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Bonaventure fait partie du groupe solidaire TUGIRUBUMWE qui fait l’agriculture des maïs. Il est marié, âgé de 43 ans et a 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 8 ans. Tous  ses enfants vont  à l’école et aucune autre personne en sa charge. Il est né au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 5 ans de l’éducation secondaire.
Il a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2008 et est au 3ème cycle de crédit. Les cycles antérieurs sont bien remboursés.
Avec le présent crédit, il va louer le champ, acheter la semence et payer la main d’œuvre. La difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt qu’anticipe Monsieur Bonaventure est le changement climatique qui peut faire que la récolte soit mauvaise.
Pour accroitre son agriculture, il a la stratégie de pratiquer l’agriculture moderne en utilisant les engrais chimiques et va chercher les marchés pour sa récolte. Il va aussi acheter son propre champ.
L’ambition pour son activité agricole est de devenir l’agriculteur professionnel. Pour sa famille, il va continuera d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
A part de l’activité financée, il fait aussi le commerce en détailles de divers objets.
texts.en:
Bonaventure is part of the Tugirubumwe solidarity group, which grows corn. He is 43 years old, married and has 4 children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old and the youngest, 8. All of his children attend school and he is responsible for no other people. He was born in Rwanda and has 5 years of secondary school education. He started to work with ACB Ltd in 2008 and is on his 3rd loan cycle. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

He will use the current loan to rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers. The one difficulty which Bonaventure foresees could cause non-repayment of this loan is climate change, which can cause a poor harvest. In order to increase his agricultural output, his strategy is to use modern farming methods, notably by using chemical fertilizers and going to look for markets for his harvest. He will also buy his own field. His business ambition is to become a professional farmer. Concerning his family, he will continue to ensure their well-being. As well as the activity being financed, he also sells various items to retail customers.

loans.use: to rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
Ratna Sari group is continuing their loans. This loan  is still used to support their efforts in breeding pigs. One member of the group couldn’t attend the meeting because of a religious ceremony at her home.

Ni Putu will use the loan to buy two piglets and feed. Currently the price for superior piglets is very expensive, Rp.500.000 per piglet. Ni Putu and all group members hope this effort will become advanced and they could become independent in the attempt so they will not need to borrow anymore.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and feed

loans.name: Jublina

texts.en:
Jublina is a 30-year-old married woman. She is blessed with a son named Fander, seven, who is attending the first grade of elementary school. Jublina runs her daily activity as a housewife. Last year, her husband supported her with a capital assistance to initiate a kiosk business. The business is hoped to bring additional income for her family. The kiosk is in front of her house nearby the main road. It helps her to reach more customers. 

Recently, Jublina planned to expand her business to produce more income as well as to meet the demand of the customers. She would like to sell various kinds of chilled soft drinks and more goods, but she has limited capital to do so. Therefore, she went to TLM and applied a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000 to be spent on a refrigerator and other kiosk items such as instant noodles, coffee, tea, snacks, etc.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and other kiosk items such as instant noodles, coffee, tea, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: José de 31 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora quien vive junto a su esposa y dos pequeños hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad. José se dedica a la reparación de aires acondicionados en automóviles, siendo esta su especialización aunque también se dedica a la reparación de todas las partes en general. Cuento con dos años de tener su taller, contando con la confianza de varios clientes. José solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar todos los repuestos necesarios para realizar más reparaciones de aires acondicionados, así mismo para comprar herramientas, válvulas entre otros más. José es responsable y desea mucho salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor gracias a su negocio.
texts.en: José is 31 years old. He is a hardworking person who lives with his wife and two young children, aged 4 and 7. José works repairing car air conditioners. This is his specialization, although he also repairs all auto parts in general. He has had his workshop for two years and has the trust of several customers.  José is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to buy all of the replacement parts he needs to do more repairs on air conditioners as well as to buy tools, such as valves, among others. José is responsible and really wants to get ahead and have a better life, thanks to his job.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts to repair automobiles.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en: Anabella is 35 years old, married to Rommel. To earn a living, Anabella is engaged in the transportation business using her motorcycle. She has been in this business for five years and earns PHP 300 a day. Right now, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy spare parts and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soles and raw material to make shoes

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, a 40-year-old married mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol, has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. This is their sole source of income.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan to buy an engine for her husband's fishing boat. With this purchase, he will be able to go back to fishing and enhance his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine.

loans.name: Noime

texts.en:
Noime, 23 years old and newly married, lives happily in a rural community planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. Due to financial difficulty, she engages in buying and selling of charcoal as well to generate additional income.

Noime and husband aim to earn more income to satisfy their necessities and save for future emergencies. To this end, she is requesting a loan of P5,000.00 to buy more stocks of charcoals to sell in the community. Through this loan, Noime believes that she will make the business profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jyambere Mugore Group

texts.fr:
Marie Gorethe fait partie du groupe solidaire JYAMBERE MUGORE qui fait l’agriculture des maïs. Elle est mariée, âgée de 32 ans et a 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 7 ans et le moins âgé a 1 année. Deux de  ses enfants vont  à l’école et une autre personne est en sa charge. Elle est née au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de l’éducation primaire.
Elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2008 et est au 4ème cycle de crédit. Les cycles antérieurs sont bien remboursés.
Avec le présent crédit, elle va louer le champ, acheter la semence et payer la main d’œuvre. Elle n’anticipe aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Pour accroitre son agriculture, elle a la stratégie de pratiquer l’agriculture moderne en utilisant les engrais chimiques. 
L’ambition pour son activité agricole est d’avoir son propre champ. Pour sa famille, elle va éduquer ses enfants et  continuera d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
A part de l’activité financée, il fait aussi le commerce en détailles de divers objets.
texts.en:
Marie Gorette is a member of the Jyambere Mugore solidarity group, which grows corn. She is 32 years old, married and has 4 children, the eldest of whom is 7 years old and the youngest, 1. Two of her children attend school and she is responsible for one other person. She was born in Rwanda and has 6 years of primary school education. She started to work with ACB Ltd in 2008 and is on her 4th loan cycle. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

With the current loan, she will rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers. She does not foresee any difficulty in repaying the loan. In order to increase her agricultural productivity, her strategy is to use modern agricultural techniques, notably chemical fertilizers. Her business ambition is to have her own field. As to her family, she will make sure her children get an education and continue to ensure her family's well-being. As well as the business being financed, she also sells various items to retail customers.

loans.use: to rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria. She previously accessed a PHP 25,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 25,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Victoria hopes to stay happy and have an abundant life. She dreams to see her business flourishing. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo, es casado y vive con su familia, tiene un hijo dependiente, vive en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Tejada Triangular  de la ciudad de El Alto.

Actualmente se dedica a realizar trabajos esporádicos como ayudante de albañil.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar materiales de construcción (cemento, arena, estuco) y así refaccionar la parte frontal de su casa.

El sueño de Cirilo es mejorar su vivienda paulatinamente.

Es la sexta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la quinta vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Cirilo is married and lives with his family. He has one dependent child and lives in his own home. The house is located in the area of Villa Tejada Triangular  of the city of El Alto.

Right now he does sporadic jobs, such as assistant bricklayer. He needs the loan to buy construction materials (cement, sand, stucco) to be able to repair the front part of his house. 

Cirilo's dream is to slowly improve his house. This is the sixth time he has asked for a loan with IMRPO and the fifth time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and stucco to repair the front part of his house.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Freasis Group

texts.es:
Doña Esperanza es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Las Freasis, tiene mucha experiencia en ese cargo porque lo ejerce hace varios años. Esta señora de 55 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, ambos mayores de edad. Ella y su esposo cuentan con una pequeña parcela que les otorgó una institución de bienestar social, donde desarrollan actividades agropecuarias, como agricultura y porcicultura que es lo que hace Doña Esperanza. Luego de 4 créditos ella ha podido aumentar su cría de cerdos, y  con este crédito desea hacerle unas mejoras a los corrales donde tiene los animales. Los financiamientos para ella han sido de gran ayuda y es lo que le ha permitido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, así como apoyar económicamente a sus hijos y nietos. 
Con Doña Esperanza hay 5 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Doña Esperanza is the president of the Banco Mujer Las Freasis group. She has a lot of experience in this role, because she has done it for a number of years. This woman of 55 is married and is the mother of two children, both adults. She and her husband have a little plot of land, which a social welfare institution granted them, where they develop agricultural activities such as farming and raising pigs, which is what Doña Esperanza does. After receiving four loans, she has been able to expand her raising of pigs, and with this loan she wants to make some improvements in the pens where she has the animals. The loans have been a great help for her and have allowed her to help her husband with the family expenses, as well as economically helping her children and grandchildren.

With Doña Esperanza are 5 more members who are going to invest in farming and animal-raising activities.

loans.use: to improve conditions in the pen where the pigs are kept

loans.name: Rubinia

texts.en: Rubinia is a 53-year-old woman. She has four children. She describes herself as a humble woman. Rubinia operates a store where she provides basic needs. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a larger business area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds to improve the business. She will use the 20,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, drinks, spices, and snack foods to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, drinks, spices, and snack foods to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn dreams of lifting her family out of poverty. She is 36 years old. She operates a store in Centro 2, Angadanan, where she sells a variety of products. She has been in this business for four years. She usually earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 a day, which is used for food and allowances. 

Marilyn’s needs additional products to sell in order to increase her profits. Therefore, she is now asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy condiments, canned goods, noodles, bread, sugar, coffee and beverages to resell in her store. In the future, she hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments, canned goods, noodles, bread, sugar, coffee and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old and is from Cabagan. She is married and has grown-up children. 

Jocelyn has a used clothing sales business, which she has been running for many years. She has applied for a loan to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock. In the near future, she hopes to see her business grow. She also hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a box of secondhand clothes for her business.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is a 57-year-old, married woman from Garcia, Bohol. She has six grown children. For the past 20 years, she and her husband have operated a fishing business together. She earns approximately 15,000 PHP per month. She and her husband use this income to meet their daily needs. 

Alberta is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and floaters. She wants to buy new fishing materials to replace the old ones. Through this loan, she will be able to catch many fish and sell them to her local community to earn more income.

In the future, Alberta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and floaters.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena, es soltera y no tiene hijos, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Cooperativa  de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudió hasta el nivel de Secundaria y actualmente se dedica al comercio de vajillas en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar más vajillas y aumentar su capital para tener mayores ventas y a si mejorar sus ingresos y  su calidad de vida

El sueño de Maria Elena es tener una negocio al por mayor de vajillas

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is single and has no children. She lives in her parents' house. The house is located in the area of Villa Cooperativa in the city of El Alto.

She went to school up to secondary school and now works selling dishes in the Ceja of the city of El Alto. She needs the loan to buy more dishes and grow her capital to have more sales and thus improve her income and quality of life. Maria Elena's dream is to have a wholesale dishes business. This is the first time she has asked for a loan with IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy more dishes to continue with her business selling them.

loans.name: Twizerane Group

texts.fr:
Patricie fait partie du groupe solidaire TWIZERANE qui fait l’agriculture des maïs. Elle est mariée, âgée de 40 ans et a 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé a 5 ans. Tous  ses enfants vont  à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge. Elle est née au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de l’éducation secondaire.
Elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2008 et est au 4ème cycle de crédit. Les cycles antérieurs sont bien remboursés.
Avec le présent crédit, elle va louer le champ, acheter la semence et payer la main d’œuvre. Le changement climatique est la seule difficulté qu’elle attend qui peut faire que ce prêt soit mal remboursé.
Pour accroitre son agriculture, elle a la stratégie de pratiquer l’agriculture moderne en utilisant les engrais chimiques. Elle va chercher les marchés pour sa récolte.
L’ambition pour son activité agricole est de devenir une agricultrice professionnelle. Pour sa famille, elle va éduquer ses enfants et  continuera d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
A part de l’activité financée, il fait aussi le commerce en détailles de divers objets.
texts.en:
Patricie is a member of the Twizerane solidarity group, which grows corn. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children, the eldest of whom is 16 years old and the youngest, 5. All of her children attend school and she is responsible for no other people. She was born in Rwanda and has 3 years of secondary school education. She started to work with ACB Ltd in 2008 and is on her 4th loan cycle. The previous loans have been correctly reimbursed.

With the current loan, she will rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers. Climate change is the only difficulty she expects which could result in poor repayment of the loan. Her strategy is to use modern agricultural techniques, notably chemical fertilizers, in order to increase her agricultural productivity. She will look for markets for her harvest. Her business ambition is to become a professional farmer. As for her family, she will make sure that her children get an education and continue to ensure her family's well-being. As well as the business being financed, she also has a business selling various items to retail customers.

loans.use: to rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers.

loans.name: María Argentina

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 40 años de edad,  es casada, tiene 7 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Hace tres años que ella se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas de diferentes diseños y también vende mercadería como ropa usada, cremas, lociones, de productos AVON. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa, donde ya cuenta con su propia clientela. Ella además recibe otros ingresos por brindar servicios de limpieza en una residencia. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de piñatas, como es el papel, pegamento y alambre, en compra de mercadería para la venta y con una parte va cubrir gastos de sus hijos en la compra de libros  y uniforme para la escuela. Ella espera que su negocio crezca y poder seguir  brindándoles la educación a sus hijos. La meta es tener ingresos para lograr construir su casa de material de bloque.
texts.en:
María, age 40, is married and has 7 children.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

She has been making different designs of piñatas for three years.  She also sells merchandise like second-hand clothes, creams, lotions, and Avon products.  She has the business set up in her house, and she has her own clientele.  She also gets other income by providing cleaning services at a house.

She will use the loan she has requested for 10,000 lempiras to buy materials to make piñatas.  She will buy things like paper, glue, and wire.  She will also buy merchandise to sell.  She will use part of the loan to cover her children’s expenses for books and school uniforms.

She hopes that her business grows and that she will be able to continue providing an education for her children.  Her goal is to have income in order to manage to build her house from cement blocks.

loans.use: to buy materials to make piñatas and merchandise and to cover her children's educational expenses.

loans.name: Dionafe

texts.en:
This is Dionafe. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase a great quantity and variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings helped her to pay for her children’s school fees and meet personal, household, and business expenses. She has operated her business for 20 years now. She and her husband, who is an employee, work hard to continuously provide for their daily needs. She also sells frozen and processed food to earn additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and pay her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial improvement with a glad and thankful heart.

Dionafe dreams of expanding her business and generating more income. She hopes to give her children a good life and an education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from her study of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen has had a grocery store business in the community for six years. She is 34 years old and married to Anthony. 

She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of foods such as canned goods, bottled goods, sugar and cooking oil. She will use the generated income to renovate and expand her store so as to accommodate more customers.

Karen hopes to open a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bottled goods, sugar and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Dukundumurimo B /gr Group

texts.fr:
Liberathe fait partie du groupe solidaire DUKUNDUMURIMO B /GR qui fait l’agriculture des maïs. Elle est mariée, âgée de 43 ans et a 6 enfants dont le plus âgé a 21 ans et le moins âgé a 4 ans. Trois de  ses enfants vont  à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge. Elle est née au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de l’éducation primaire.
Elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2012 et est au 2ème cycle de crédit. Le cycle antérieur est bien remboursé.
Avec le présent crédit, elle va louer le champ, acheter la semence et payer la main d’œuvre. Elle n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Pour accroitre son agriculture, elle a la stratégie de chercher le marché de bon prix pour sa récolte.
L’ambition pour son activité agricole est de devenir une agricultrice professionnelle. Pour sa famille, elle va éduquer ses enfants et  continuera d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Liberathe is a member of the Dukundumurimo B /gr solidarity group, which grows corn. She is 43 years old, married and has 6 children, the eldest of whom is 21 years old and the youngest, 4. Three of her children go to school and she is responsible for no other people. She was born in Rwanda and has 8 years of primary school education. She started working with ACB Ltd in 2012 and is on her 2nd loan cycle. The previous loan has been properly repaid.

With the current loan, she will rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers. She expects no difficulties in repaying this loan. Her strategy to increase her business is to find a market where she can sell her harvest at a good price. Her business ambition is to become a professional farmer. As for her family, she will make sure that her children get an education and continue to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Abihuje / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Phoibe fait partie du groupe solidaire ABIHUJE / RBV qui fait l’agriculture des maïs. Elle est mariée, âgée de 31 ans et a 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 11 ans et le moins âgé a 3 ans. Trois de  ses enfants vont  à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge. Elle est née au Rwanda.
Elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2008 et est au 2ème cycle de crédit. Le cycle antérieur est bien remboursé.
Avec le présent crédit, elle va louer le champ, acheter la semence et payer la main d’œuvre. Elle n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Pour accroitre son agriculture, elle a la stratégie de moderniser son agriculture en utilisant les engrais chimiques.
L’ambition pour son activité agricole est d’avoir son propre champs. Pour sa famille, elle va éduquer ses enfants et  continuera d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Phoibe is a member of the Abihuje / Rbv solidarity group, which grows corn. She is 31 years old, married and has 5 children, the eldest of whom is 11 years old and the youngest, 3. Three of her children attend school and she is not responsible for any other people. She was born in Rwanda. She started working with ACB Ltd in 2008 and is on her 2nd loan cycle. The previous loan was properly repaid.

With the current loan, she will rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers. She is not expecting any difficulties in repaying this loan. Her strategy to increase her production is to modernize her farming techniques and use chemical fertilizers. Her business ambition is to have her own field. As for her family, she will make sure that her children get an education and continue to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Morn's Group

texts.en:
Morn is 44 years old and married. She has four children. She and her family live in a village of the Kandal Steong district of Kandal province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 15 years, earning about 23,000 KHR per day.

Morn has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She fully paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan 160,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a proper latrine for her family's use, including a latrine bowl, sewage draining materials, and tile. Morn is pleased that this loan will help her improve her family's health and well-being in this way.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a proper latrine.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Ángela vive en Libertad, tiene 41 años de edad. Ella empezó vendiendo confitería; luego decidió vender  productos de primera necesidad. En la actualidad ya tiene una tienda. El trabajo lo realiza sola de lunes a domingo de 7 de la mañana a 8 de la noche.

Hasta ahora que tiene una tienda general de víveres. Teme que no tenga financiamiento o ingreso de capital.

No está casada, tiene hijos y estudian en una escuela fiscal para ello la clienta se esfuerza día a día para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Con el préstamo solicita comprar más productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, frutas, enlatados para así poder surtir más su tienda o negocio, para mayores ingresos de capital y con ello poner comercializar vendiendo al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ángela, age 41, lives in Libertad.  She started out selling sweets.  Then she decided to sells basic needs products.  She now has a store.  She works alone Monday through Sunday from seven in the morning until eight at night.  She now has a general supply store.  She fears that she will not have financing or income.

She is not married, but she does have children who attend public school.  She puts forth great effort day to day in order to get her children ahead.

She will use the requested loan to buy more basic needs products like rice, sugar, fruit, and canned goods.  She will do this in order to be able to better stock her store or business.  She will do this to get greater income, and then she will able to sell in bulk.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, fruit, and canned goods.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has three children and has been doing this work for 11 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, crops and personal business. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Being able to meet family needs from agricultural income." Her biggest challenge is "high costs of inputs." The animal on the farm is named Lelmet.

Jane was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Got information concerning Juhudi from a neighbour."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. The client learnt the saving culture for the purpose of acquiring credit to boost working capital.

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Jane replied, "Increased working capital thus boosting production."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jane owns the following: cow, poultry but does not own pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower does not have mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Soern's Group

texts.en:
Soern, 60, is widowed. She lives in a rural area of Kandal province's Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. Rice farming has been her main source of income for 20 years. The current business earns her approximately KHR 17,000 per day to meet her family's needs.

Soern's group, of which she is the leader, consists of two members who live in the same village. She is a first-time borrower with VisionFund. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan of 160,000 KHR each. Soern is going to use her portion to buy materials to build a decent latrine such as a latrine bowl, tile, draining, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthful latrine to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Mouy's Group

texts.en:
Mouy, 38, lives in a rural area of the Monkoul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. Mouy has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To support the family, she has been raising pigs and her husband is a fisherman in local area to earn additional income for her family. Engaging in this business for 18 years, she can earn about 12,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 4,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Mouy has been with VisionFund for five cycles while the other member have been with VisionFund from one to three cycles. She is now leading her group of three to request a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy materials for building a proper latrine. She hopes to have healthful latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a proper latrine.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Dufatanye Bategarugori Group

texts.fr:
Dative fait partie du groupe solidaire DUFATANYE BATEGARUGORI qui fait l’agriculture des maïs. Ellen’ est pas mariée légalement, âgée de 54 ans et a 6 enfants dont le plus âgé a 29 ans et le moins âgé a 12 ans. Quatre de  ses enfants vont  à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge. Elle est née au Rwanda.
Elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2008 et est au 4ème cycle de crédit. Les cycle antérieurs sont bien remboursés.
Avec le présent crédit, elle va louer le champ, acheter la semence et payer la main d’œuvre. Elle n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Pour accroitre son agriculture, elle a la stratégie de moderniser son agriculture en utilisant les engrais chimiques.
L’ambition pour son activité agricole est de devenir l’agricultrice professionnelle. Pour sa famille, elle va éduquer ses enfants et  continuera d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dative is a member of the Dufatanye Bategarugori solidarity group, which grows corn. She is 54 years old, not legally married and has 6 children, the eldest of whom is 29 years old and the youngest, 12. Four of her children go to school and she is responsible for no other people. She was born in Rwanda. She started working with ACB Ltd in 2008 and is on her 4th loan cycle. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

With this current loan, she will rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers. She does not expect any difficulties in repaying this loan. Her strategy to increase her agricultural output is to modernise her farming techniques by using chemical fertilizers. Her business ambition is to become a professional farmer. As far as her family is concerned, she will see that her children get an education and continue to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Sehati Damai 2 Group

texts.en:
The “Sehati Damai 2” is made up of four ladies who are working in different businesses. All of the group’s members have great charisma, are happy and are always looking for a reason to smile. 

Anita is one of the members receiving her second loan with her friends. She lives in the Susukan area east of Jakarta and she is a very happy, friendly lady. She is 38 years old, married, and has a fourteen-year-old son and a ten-year-old daughter who attend a school near their house. Her husband is a mechanic. They don’t have a home of their own, but rent.

Anita is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She makes and sells various cakes around her neighborhood. She’s been doing this for 2 years. From the income she can pay her house rent and pay her children's school fees.

She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients for her cakes, such as flour, sugar, coconut and rice, and continue her business. Her dream is to travel to Saudi Arabia and to send her children to a famous university.

loans.use: to buy coconut, sugar, flour (30 kilos) and rice (20 liters).

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en: Juanito is a 42-year-old married man and the father of 8 children. They live in Bohol, Philippines. Juanito has been a fisherman for more than 15 years. This is the source of his income. He is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of his fishing boat. With this, he will be able to improve his fishing business and augment his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of his fishing boat.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Her spouse is a welder. They both work hard to meet their daily needs and obtain greater income. Violeta would like to be sure of  good nutrition for her hogs, which is the reason she's applying for additional capital of PHP 5,000, which will allow her to buy hog feed and essential vitamins for her business of raising hogs. She really hopes to get a loan in this amount, so she can make progress with her business, some day. In addition, she could have a better standard of living and educate her two children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business of raising hogs.

loans.name: Twiyubake Rhh Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne fait partie du groupe solidaire TWIYUBAKE RHH qui fait l’agriculture des maniocs. Elle est mariée, âgée de 40 ans et a 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 11 ans. Cinq de  ses enfants vont  à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge. Elle est née au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de l’école primaire.
Elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2012 et est au 3ème cycle de crédit. Les cycles antérieurs sont bien remboursés.
Avec le présent crédit, elle va acheter la semence, les engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre. Elle n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Pour accroitre son agriculture, elle a la stratégie d’améliorer son activité en la modernisant.
L’ambition pour son activité agricole est de devenir la distributrice des maniocs dans sa région. Pour sa famille, elle a l’ambition d’assurer les frais médicaux et les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a member of the Twiyubake Rhh solidarity group, which grows cassava. She is 40 years old, married and has 5 children, the eldest of whom is 22 years old and the youngest, 11. Five of her children go to school and she is responsible for no other people. She was born in Rwanda and has 6 years of primary school education. She started working with ACB Ltd in 2012 and is on her 3rd loan cycle. The previous loans were correctly reimbursed.

With this current loan, she will buy seeds and chemical fertilizers and pay the labourers. She does not expect to have any difficulties repaying this loan. Her strategy to increase her agricultural output is to improve her farming business by modernising her farming techniques. Her business ambition is to become the main distributor of cassava in her region. As far as her family is concerned, her aim is to cover her children's medical and education expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical fertilizers and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice for in larger quantities, and of better quality, for her rice-selling business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has four children and has been doing this work for five years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.
