She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “improving my breeds!” Her biggest challenge is “dairy feeds.” The animal on the farm is named “Denliii”. Nancy will use the loan proceeds to buy and insure a dairy cow. Nancy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: “They have good training program.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: “Records management.” Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked “How will this loan benefit your family?”, Nancy replied “I will get milk to pay school.”
As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Nancy owns the following: “cow, poultry” but does not own “pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.” Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household “mosquito net, TV, DVD” but does not have “electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine.”

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 39-year-old married woman.  She has three children, and they live in Ubay, Bohol. Leah has been in the rice farming business with her husband for more than 22 years, and this has been the source of their income.

Leah is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and eventually, their harvest.

In the future, Leah hopes to expand their farm so that it will continue to generate income and profit. Leah also wants to save money so that she can repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Joelyn

texts.en: Joelyn is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of three young children. They live in Bohol, Philippines. Joelyn has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than seven years. Joelyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and hooks. With this loan, she and her husband will be able to improve their fishing ventures and augment their income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and hooks for the fishing business she conducts with her husband.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is 40 years old, married, and has four school-age children. She and her husband aim to improve their standard of living and educate their children. Due to financial challenges, Martina engages in the hog-raising business to generate additional income. She wants to raise more pigs to sell, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, Martina is asking for an additional loan of PHP 50,000 to buy the necessary feed, vitamins and vaccines, as well as additional piglets to raise. Through patience and hard work, Martina believes that, some day, she will improve the business and make it a more viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines, as well as additional piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Teodosio

texts.es:
Teodosio, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus tíos, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El estudió hasta el nivel de Secundaria y actualmente se dedica al comercio de polleras (faldas plizadas para mujeres del campo) y enaguas en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar más polleras y enaguas para tener mayores  ingresos y mejorar sus ventas y su calidad de vida

El sueño de Teodosio es tener un negocio mas prospero.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Teodosio is a single man who doesn't have children and lives at his uncles' house, located in Villa Ingenio in the city of El Alto. He has high-school level education and currently works selling "polleras" (pleated skirts for rural women) and underskirts at La Ceja in the city of El Alto. 

He's requesting a loan to buy more "polleras" and underskirts with an aim to increase revenue and improve sales and his quality of life. Teodosio's dream is to have a more successful business. This is his first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy "polleras" (traditional skirts) and underskirts for retail sale.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is 55 years old and married to Juma. They have one child. Three years ago, Mwanasiti started a retail shop selling palm tree leaves for roof thatching with a little capital which they invested in primary needs products. She also had another job farming. Now her business is very large and she has more customers than before.

Mwanasiti is asking for this loan to invest in palm tree leaves. She is grateful for this opportunity as it will be very helpful to her business.

loans.use: to invest in palm tree leaves to sell for roof thatching.

loans.name: Umwete Iii Group

texts.fr:
Juvénal  fait partie du groupe Umwete III  et  habite à Ngozi. Il a 35 ans et est marié à Jeannette, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants,agés de 1 à 11 ans,  dont 2 étudient.

Il fait le commerce  de patate douce,  de la bière locale, du manioc ,depuis 15ans; il pratique aussi  de l’agriculture.  

Il  est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de patates douces, de manioc, et de bananes pour préparer beaucoup de litres de la bière locale, à vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter un terrain cultivable et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Juvenal is a member of the Umwete III group and lives in Ngozi. He is 35 years old and married to Jeannette, a produce farmer. They have five children from one to 11 years of age, two of whom are in school.

He  has been selling sweet potatoes, local beer and manioc (cassava) for 15 years. He also works as a farmer.
He is on his second loan with Turame. He will use his Kiva loan to bolster his capital and stock up on sweet potatoes and manioc as well as bananas to prepare large quantities of local beer for resale, to increase his earnings. In the years to come, he would like to buy a plot of arable land and provide for his children’s studies.

loans.use: stock up on sweet potatoes, manioc and bananas to prepare large quantities of local beer for resale, to increase his earnings.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has three children.  Her primary income sources are crops, transportation services, and employment income.  She has been doing this work for four years.  

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming, "Earning from agriculture!" She states her biggest challenge is "Lack of funding to boost production." The animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Chepkenyuk.'

Zipporah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied  "Learned about Juhudi from the spouse".  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, "How to get finance to practice agri-business".

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Zipporah replied "Increased income to help with family needs".

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Zipporah owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and materials to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Hazelyn

texts.en:
Hazelyn is a very determined and enthusiastic woman. She lives in the San Pablo province of Isabela. She is the mother of six children whom she loves very much; they are her reason for living. 

Her business is hog-raising. She believes that her business is going well because she is doing everything she can to make it successful.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Beijing Group

texts.en:
Tatu, who is in her late 20s, is married with two boys--one goes to school and the other is not yet old enough for school. She has had a business selling fish for five years now. She is a really hard working woman. She works from 8 am to 10 pm daily and is able to earn a good profit per month.  

This will be her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy more fish, build a house, buy a cupboard, cover school fees for her boy, and for home expenses and has paid back all her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy fish to increase her sales. Tatu's dream is to one day be able to build a nice family house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group " Beijing " which totals 10 members. The members of this group will hold each accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish to increase her sales .

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is from Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 62 years old, and single. To make a living, Ernesto owns and operates a specialized retail store.  He sells a variety of products: sugar, coffee, noodles, eggs, soy sauce, vinegar, and other basic needs in the local community. Ernesto has been in his business for more than five years and earns 10,200PHP per month from his business. 

In 2011, Ernesto joined GDMPC. Ernesto is requesting a loan of 20,000PHP to purchase supplementary products to sell in his retail store. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his grocery store business, and  a fraction of his profit will be saved.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary products to sell in his retail grocery store.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. He has been in the business for more than two years now, transporting passengers in his town in Bohol, Philippines. 

Leonides is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle. With this loan, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the vehicle.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Alecor

texts.en:
Alecor is a 25-year-old, married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has operated her farming business for 15 years now, together with her husband. This is where she gets her income to cover their daily needs.

Alecor is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. This will be used to grow healthy rice. With the help of this loan, she will be able to harvest good and healthy rice. In the future, Alecor hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene  25 años , es soltero y no tiene hijos, cuenta con una casa propia que esta siendo construida  a base de su esfuerzo y dedicación . Carlos se dedica al transporte de pasajeros por dentro y fuera de la ciudad ya que posee un mototaxi que le permite realizar esta actividad.  Realiza este trabajo por casi 2 años y en este corto tiempo ha sabido enfrentar todo tipo de situaciones , tambien manifiesta que le agrada mucho su trabajo porque  tiene la ventaja de  organizar su propio tiempo , actualmente le está yendo muy bien ya que ha aprendido a determinar las horas y  los lugares en los que siempre encuentra pasajeros disponibles . Le gustaría continuar trabajando y a su vez comprar otro vehículo que le servira para ponerlo en alquiler .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, por tanto agradece a quienes financian su crédito y le dan el apoyo necesario para continuar con sus objetivos y a su vez ser puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará 3 llantas que necesita para refaccionar su mototaxi ya que con el mal estado de las pistas y el paso del tiempo se deteriorarón, también tapizará su vehículo y pagará los gastos de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 25-year old man, single and with no children. He owns a house that he's currently building with a lot of effort and dedication. Carlos makes a living carrying passengers inside and outside the city and uses his motorcycle taxi. After almost 2 years at this job, he has been exposed to all kind of situations and says he enjoys what he does and the fact that he can organize his own time. Things are going well now for him as he's learned to identify the hours and places where he always finds available passengers. He would like to continue working and to buy another vehicle for rentals. 

He's requesting a loan for 1,000 soles and is grateful to those that fund it and give him the necessary support to continue working towards his goals and to be punctual and responsible in his payments. He plans to use the loan to buy three tires to repair his motorcycle taxi, deteriorated as a result of the bad conditions of the roads and the passing of time. He'll also upholster his vehicle and pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy tires and upholstery for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Nelva

texts.en: Nelva is 44 years old and lives in the San Pablo province of Isabela. She is married with three children. Nelva has a shop that sells personal items. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.use: to purchase lotion, shampoo, toothpaste, soap and powder for her business

loans.name: Mzalendo Group

texts.en:
Janerose is a member of Mzalendo Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 16 One Acre Fund farmers,14 women and 2 men. Janerose is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Janerose joined One Acre Fund during the long rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the long rains 2013 season. Janerose joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and access the best input prices.

Janerose reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 4.5 bags of maize per 3/4 acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during long rains 2012, she harvested 12 bags per 3/4 acre!  

She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to repair her home. During the 2013 long rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Janerose’s group will receive 8 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en: Manana is 41 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, three children, and an infant grandson. Her husband works as a driver for a private company and gets a monthly income. Manana is involved in the trading business. She purchases clothing and bed-clothing at wholesale prices and then resells among her villagers. Manana is a very hard-working woman and has rich experience in her business. She requested a loan to purchase stock of clothing and bed-clothing to resell and increase the income of her family. Manana will reinvest the increased income in her business for further development. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothing and bed-clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Zulayho

texts.ru:
Зулайхо 31 год, она жительница города Худжанд. Зулайхо воспитывает троих детей. Ее муж уехал на заработки в Россию. 
Зулайхо обратилась в Хумо за кредитом в размере 10 000 TJS для покупки ингредиентов для приготовления пирожков. Она занимается приготовлением и продажей пирожков с картофелем, пирожков с колбасой и беляшей. Зулайхо работает возле базаре, она работает 22 дня в месяц. У нее также имеется продуктовый магазин, где она работает продавщицей.
texts.en: Zulayho is 31 years old and she lives in the city of Khujand.  She is raising three children - her husband left to work in Russia.  Zulayho turned to Humo for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy ingredients for making pies.  She works as a baker and sells pies filled with potato, sausage and ground meat.  She works near the bazaar, where she trades for 22 days of each month.  She also has a grocery shop where she works as a cashier.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making pies

loans.name: Jaime Javier

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 30 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Él tiene varios años de dedicarse al oficio de molinero; lo aprendió de su padre. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a prepararse e irse a su trabajo, debido a que debe entrar temprano a su trabajo. Mientras su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cemento, hierro, ladrillo; para construir su vivienda. Con la inversión, podrá brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna, ya que en la casa que vive actualmente es de lámina. Uno de sus sueños, es comprar su propio molino e instalarlo en su casa, y ya no ser un empleado.
texts.en:
Jaime is 30 years old. He is in a relationship and has two children. He has devoted himself to the milling profession; he learned it from his father. He gets up at 4:00 a.m. to get himself ready to go to work since he must get to work early. Meanwhile, his wife does the housework.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy cement, iron, and bricks to construct his home. With the investment, he will be able to provide a dignified home for his family, since the house in which they currently live is made of sheet metal. One of his dreams to buy his own mill and install it in his home in order to no longer be an employee.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, and brick to construct his home.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline, 33 years old, is married to Erenio with four children. She has been engaged in the business of raising hogs for three years. She is a hardworking mother. Jacqueline is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy foods and vitamins for her hog raising business. She hopes that in the future she can buy more pigs to raise.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed and vitamins for her farming business.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 40 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural venture; she plants and harvests bananas for sale to earn a living. She sells her harvested bananas to her contract buyer. With this line of business, she is able to raise 1,750 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month. She's been with her business for over six years. 

She requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Jojo

texts.en:
Jojo, 27, is married and has one child. For the past eleven years he has earned a living operating a motorcycle transport.

Jojo would like to buy new tires, a chain and a sprocket, plus change the motorcycle’s oil to insure his his motorcycle’s reliability and passengers’ safety, but he hasn’t enough capital to do so. So he is applying for a loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI to cover these costs. He knows this loan would help him to provide good customer service and so increase his income. He is looking forward to approval of his requested loan.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a chain and a sprocket, plus change his motorcycle’s oil.

loans.name: Urnisa

texts.ru: Урнисе 44 года, замужем.Мать троих детей, старший сын помогает матери по хозяйству. Двое младших работают в Москве, отправляют деньги матери.  Урниса в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1998 года занимается животноводством и пчеловодством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 1,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня в хозяйстве Урнисы насчитывается 6 овец, 5 коров,1 лошадь и 10 пчелиных улей, что приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с перепродажи скота и продажи меда. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Урниса обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и сахара для пчел. Доходы от кредита Урниса планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Urnisa is 44 years old and is married with three children.  Her eldest son helps her around the farm, and her two younger children work in Moscow and send money home to their mother.  Urnisa has been raising raising livestock and keeping bees as a source of income for her family since 1998.  She started this business with 1,000 som (KGS).  On her farm today, Urnisa has six sheep, five cows, one horse and ten beehives, all of which bring in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month through the sale of livestock and honey.  With the goal of developing her business further, Ulrisa turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow and sugar for her bees.  She plans to reinvest the income from this loan into developing her business further.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow and sugar for honeybees.

loans.name: Sari Indah Group

texts.en: With 10 members, the Sari Indah group continues to borrow loans from MUK to expand their businesses. They want success and to develop their families' welfare. Ni Ayu will use her portion of the loan to buy 2 more piglets for fattening and feed for them. Currently, she already has a sow. Cages have been prepared to accommodate the piglets to be born. She has a plan for selling the piglets. Her husband is very supportive of her efforts since they have proven to benefit the welfare of his family. Ni Ayu hopes her efforts will help her business grow and be successful.

loans.use: To buy 2 more piglets for fattening and feed for them.

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en: Baatar is 39 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a ger (traditional nomadic tent) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife Narmandah works at the local market as a saleswoman. His son Hosbayar, age 17, and daughter Hishigjargal, age 11, go to local schools. Baatar has been working as a butcher for years, and he is now starting his own business selling meat products in town. He has built a strong business network, and he is now requesting 360,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of livestock intestines, heads, and other organs to sell to large manufacturers in the capital city. He is hardworking, friendly, and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of offal to sell

loans.name: Basandagul

texts.en:
Basandagul was born in 1993. She is a very successful and hardworking woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. She is a student in her third year of medical college. She studies well for good and excellent marks. She actively takes part in all competitions at the college. Also she has many friends, and all her friends love her because she is very kind. 

She has one dream: ‘To be a good doctor and to serve the people.’ She must pay her tuition but her parents do not have enough money to pay it, so Basandagul is asking for a loan to pay her tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay her tuition.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is from Bañadero, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. 

To make a living, she owns and operates a general store in the local community, selling shampoo, cooking oil, salt, sugar, candies, food for snacks, soap for washing clothes, and other items. She has been in this business for eight years and earns PHP 9,000 per month. 

In 2007, Ritchel joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to gain access to finances. Ritchel is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000 to purchase additional goods to sell. She plans to expand her business and save a portion of her income to buy a refrigerator, so she can make ice candy and ice water to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 38 years old, married and has two school-age children. Due to financial difficulties, she aims to improve her variety store to generate sufficient income to support the education of her children and satisfy their basic necessities. She has been operating the business for almost two years and usually earns a profits of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month that she utilizes for food, clothing and the allowances of her children in school. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, Rosalia needs to increase her income to finance the education of her children. In this regard, she is asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy more stock of canned goods, snack foods, noodles, soaps, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables to sell. She is hoping that someday, she will make the business grow and be more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, snack foods, noodles, soaps, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El Sr. Félix tiene 49 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 16 y 18 años,  el se dedica a la venta de ropa,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la localidad de Ivirgarzama, este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Félix va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, El Sr. Félix enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes.
texts.en: Felix is 49 years old and has two children ages 16 and 18.  He works in clothing sales, and his shop is located in region of Lvirgarzama.  This loan is his first with the institution.  Felix will use this loan to buy wholesale clothing for his business.  His reason for requesting the loan is a lack of capital.  Felix faces challenges in his business like daily competition.  He will use the benefits to continue improving his shop. His wish is to for his business to have enough merchandise and supplies to offer a variety of products to his clients.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy sheep and goats for animal-selling business

loans.name: Bebiano

texts.en:
Bebiano is 55 years old, married, with four children. He lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Bebiano gets busy doing his agricultural business, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to the local community. He's been engaged with this business for over 30 years and generates PHP 1,210 per month.

Bebiano has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer for bananas. Bebiano continues his plan to let his children finish their college and to improve his house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for bananas.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
This is Danilo, 31, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. He is married to Rose, an employee. He and his wife are managing their household while both of them work to sustain their financial expenses. 

Danilo is a coconut vendor. Most coconuts in the Philippines are sold by street vendors pushing deep wooden carts. The coconuts are served by cutting into one end and serving it with a straw, using the coconut as a container itself. Also, coconuts can be served with the juice and edible part of the coconut in a plastic cup with a straw. Regular customers are those who are thirsty and those who want to refresh themselves from the heat of the sun. They earn a minimum of PHP 200 per day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP10,000. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more coconuts.

Danilo hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts needed for her business.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva runs a retail stall where she offers tobacco, betel nuts and betel leaf for sale. She has been engaged in this kind of business for four years.Every day, she wakes up early in the morning to prepare her family's needs, after which she goes immediately to her stall to display the products she offers. 

Minerva planned to buy stocks of tobacco, betel leaf and ten cans of betel nuts but due to the expensive cost of betel nuts, she decided to request a loan of PHP 13,000. She hopes to get this loan amount so she can earn higher income which will serve for her family's basic necessities, improvement of their lifestyle, and the education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy ten cans of betel nuts, betel leaf and tobacco for her specialized retail stall

loans.name: Stephany

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Stephany engages in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 33 years old and has three school-age children. Being responsible parents, they aim to educate their children and give them a better life. For this reason, Stephany planned to improve and strengthen her business to generate sufficient income. To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 40,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve the business, and she is hoping that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia, 53, is married to Edwin who operates a food business. Rosalia has a store where she sells different vegetables, such as squash, eggplant, tomatoes and cabbage. She has three children who are in school and help with the housework. Rosalia says her parents were the ones who taught her the merchant trade, and her siblings also have their own businesses.

Rosalia is requesting a loan to buy squash, eggplant, tomatoes, cabbage and Chinese pechay (bokchoy) so she can continue offering her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplant, tomatoes, cabbage and Chinese pechay (bokchoy) for her store.

loans.name: Lomas Del Sur Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOMAS DEL SUR está compuesto por ocho integrantes, todas mujeres, la presidenta del banco es La Sra. Flora tiene dos hijos , ella se dedica  a la va elaboración y venta de chocolates artesanales, va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de cacao por mayor y azúcar, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital, la Sra. Flora enfrenta retos en su negocio ya por estas fechas los  precios de sus materia prima incrementan,  por este motivo solicita el crédito ya que quiere abastecerse de estos productos ya que esta época también i incrementa sus ventas y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando productos para su negocio la Sra. flora es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The business bank Lomas del Sur is made up of eight members, all women. The president of the bank is Flora. She has two children. She makes a living producing and selling handcrafted chocolates.

She is going to use the loan to invest in the purchase of cocoa and sugar wholesale. Her reason for applying for this loan is the lack of capital. Flora is facing challenges in her business. The price of her primary materials has increased lately. For this reason, she is requesting the loan since she wants to stock up on these products. During this time period her sales also increase and she is going to use the benefits to continue buying products for her business. 

Flora is a very hardworking woman. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy supplies to produce chocolates.

loans.name: Venezuela Group

texts.en:
Aranyael, who is in his early 40s, is married with four children (a boy and girls) who are in school. For a period of 20 years now, he has been running cargo transportation activities. He is doing well in his business; he works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to earn a good profit per month. 

This will be his 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He has used the previous loans to buy a three-wheel motorcycle for transporting passengers, started building his family house, paid school fees and covered home expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He will use this loan to open a broiler selling business. His dream is to become a good father who provides his children with a better quality education, as well as to manage to expand his business.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "VENEZUELA," which totals 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a broiler selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 35 years old and a widow with four children. She lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over three years, she has owned and operated a specialized food business in the local community, selling bananacue, biscuits, fried wrapped banana, and fishballs; she earns PHP 3,000 each month. 

Josephine joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010. She is requesting a loan of PHP 24,000 to purchase canned goods and raw ingredients for food preparation. She plans to expand the business and purchase a house and lot through Camella Homes.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and raw ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Hog-raising is the primary source of income for Yolanda. She is 50 years old and a responsible mother of two children. She raised her children through her hog-raising business. She has been in this business for five years and usually earns about PHP 7,500 per hog she sells. 

Yolanda wants to have more hogs to raise, but she lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 17,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 45 years old and lives with his wife, parents, and 20-year-old son who is a soldier. David is a driver and works locally to earn a monthly income. His wife is unemployed and his parents are pensioners. 

The family has 24 pigs and sells piglets seasonally. They also have a vineyard and the harvested grape are sold locally in the village. David has been working hard already for 25 years every day from early morning till late evening to do his best for his family, but he still doesn’t have enough income to expand his family business to make living conditions better. 

With the requested loan David wants to buy a car to use for agricultural business. The car will help him to look after his vineyard better and transport harvested products easier. This will increase his income, and with the profits he will cultivate more land and harvest more agricultural products.

David awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a car to use for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Lorreine

texts.es: Lorreine de 49 años, esta casada con Estanis de 62 años con quien tiene cuatro hijos , ambos tienen una casa propia lugar  donde comparten sus días en familia.Lorreine trabaja  en la confección y arreglo de prendas de vestir. Trabaja en su hogar , desde donde espera la llegada de sus vecinos, amigos o personas conocidas que tengan la necesidad de obtener alguna prenda exclusiva para una ocasión especial o que sencillamente requieran de alguna labor pequeña , como enmendar alguna prenda, colocar un botón en alguna camisa o colocar un cierre en alguna vestimenta de uso diario. Lleva en este trabajo más de 10 años y lo hace con una máquina de coser antigua a la cual guarda mucho cariño por considerarla su fiel compañera. Brinda siempre una agradable atención , cualidad que le ha servido para culminar su trabajo con una excelente calidad en los acabados.Asegura tener muchos clientes que siempre se quedan contentos al ver el trabajo final.Ahora espera establecer un negocio de costura mucho mas completo y para iniciar este sueño necesita comprar una máquina de coser nueva para emprender su camino hacia el progreso.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles y está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, ella por su parte se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual en el pago de sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, botones y agujas.
texts.en:
Lorreine, 49, is married to Estanis, 62. They have four children and live in their own house, where they spend their days together as a family. Lorreine tailors and fixes clothes at home, where she waits for neighbors, friends or acquaintances to come with special requests, e.g. for a special occasion or just because they need a small fix (like fixing a garment, sewing a button to a shirt or a zipper to a dress).

Lorreine has worked in this activity for ten years. She takes great care of her old sewing machine and considers it her loyal companion. She takes good care of her clients, which has helped her to provide an excellent quality. Lorreine says that many of her clients are satisfied when they see the final results. She now hopes to open a more complete business, and in order to pursue her dream and progress, she needs to buy a new sewing machine

This time, she is requesting 500 soles [PEN] and feels happy knowing that she has a financial support that enables her to continue working. She promises to continue paying the installments on time. With the loan, she will buy materials such as fabrics, threads, buttons and needles.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies, such as fabrics, threads, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es:
Achuapa es un pequeño poblado donde elaboran riquísimas rosquillas a base de leche y cuajada que tienen tanta fama por su buena calidad que la exportan fuera del país.

En este pueblo luchador habita doña Rosa Marlene, una profesora de 48 años que se ha dedicado casi toda su vida a impartir clases de primaria a niños de comarcas rurales y que por su carisma es muy querida por sus alumnos y los padres de estos niños.

Se siente muy satisfecha porque en todos estos años ha brindado un poquito de arena al desarrollo de Nicaragua formando profesionales que son el futuro del país.

Con gran esmero esta señora a pesar de su edad sale de su casa a las 5 am para estar puntual en su centro de labores y dar lo mejor de su experiencia.

En los últimos días se ha sentido un poquito mal de salud por este motivo está solicitando un crédito para comprar medicamentos y realizarse exámenes médicos con el fin de mejorar su salud y seguir luchando por brindar lo mejor a sus alumnos.

Solicita a los inversionistas de Kiva que le brinden su apoyo a través de Ceprodel para mejorar su salud y agradece de antemano por esta gran ayuda a personas de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Achuapa is a small village where delicious pastries with a milk and cheese base are made and are very famous for their high quality.  They are exported outside of the country.

Rosa Marlene lives in this feisty village.  She is a 48 year old teacher that has worked almost all of her life teaching elementary school age children from rural regions.  Because of her charisma, she is very loved by her students and the parents of her students.

She is very satisfied because in all of these years she has offered a little to the development of Nicaragua, forming professionals that are the future of the country.

This woman leaves her house at 5 am every morning, with great trouble and despite her age, to be punctual in her workplace and give the best of herself.

In recent days, she has been in bad health.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy medication and get medical examinations with the goal of improving her health and continuing to fight to bring the best to her students.

She is requesting the support of Kiva investors through Ceprodel to improve her health, and thanks them in advance for their great help for people who have limited resources.

loans.use: to buy medication and pay for medical examinations.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is a hardworking and smart woman. She is married and has 3 children. She works at the hospital as a nurse and has a small salary. Her husband is a worker and he also has a small salary. 

Gulnora always wanted to be a businesswoman to find a source of income. She got information from her friend about the course ‘To Get Ahead’ with a women's organization. She took part in this course and got enough skills about business. 

She wants to organize a business of sewing women's clothes. Her husband will help her with the business. She is asking for a loan of 800 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business. She will get through, using the loan, and her business will go on to be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.en: Mukadas is a beautiful and good natured person. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver and tries to provide his family with good living conditions. Mukadas is a student taking four courses at the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. She studies in the program of Management of Education. She is one of the best students and studies very well. She must pay her tuition, but this year her husband does not have the money. She is asking for a loan to pay her tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay her tuition.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 12 years.  Her primary income sources are milk and crops, her personal businesses.

She stated that what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Growing vegetables for sale!' Her biggest challenge is: 'Poor market prices and climatic fluctuations.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kamagut and Chesiror.' Esther will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Esther was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'I was introduced to Juhudi by a friend.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to work in a group, save and acquire credit for development.'

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Esther replied, 'The family will acquire a dairy cow for milk production.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Esther owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household '    ', but does not have 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Carmelita is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers, then sells them individually (5 gallons per container) at a profit. She also sells rice for additional income. Her regular customers for her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Carmelita hopes that she will be successful in her businesses and dreams they will have their own lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Sinorinha

texts.en: Sinorinha is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. Her husband works for Federation Cooperation (an NGO). She runs a kiosk to help generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, including cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, and Fanta), and biscuits. Sinorinha opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $90. She is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, and Fanta), and biscuits.

loans.name: Rovilyn

texts.en:
Rovilyn is a mother who has four school-age children. She and her husband aim to uplift their status of living to give their children a better life. She is engaged in the buying and selling of fruits and vegetables to help her husband in generating income. 

She plans to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell, but she she has inadequate capital. For this reason, Rovilyn is asking for an additional of 10,000 PHP to buy more stock of mangoes, papayas, onions, garlic, beans, squash, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes to sell. 

She believes that, someday, her business will become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mangoes, papayas, onions, garlic, beans, squash, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 33 years old and a mother of two young children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than seven years now. This is the source of their income. 

Liezel is asking for a loan to be used as an additional payment for purchasing boat. With this, her husband will be able to go back to his fishing business since they can have a new fishing boat. 

In the future, Liezel hopes to expand their fishing business and make it successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
This is Trinidad. Her previous loan was a big help in her food stall business. She was able to buy all the ingredients and products needed in her business, which gave her the opportunity for higher income. She has been in this business for 10 years now and it continues to grow. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs, especially for the education of their children.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and other products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Trinidad hopes to give her children a good life and education and dreams that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Composed of 15 to 30 community partners, the fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy sheep and goats for her husband's business.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela lives peacefully in Libag Sur with her spouse and children. She runs a small store and a hog raising business for income. From her store, she gains about 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month. The money goes to school fees, daily meals, bills at home, and also feed for her hogs. She was very determined in achieving good sales; that is why she is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits, sugar, coffee, and bread to sell in her store. It will help attract more customers to buy her products; therefore, her income will also increase.

With determination and patience in developing her business, Graciela will continue to generate good profits in order to establish a successful business for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, biscuits, sugar, coffee, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, three children, and mother-in-law in the small village of Kurdghelauri. Marine’s husband works as a driver locally and gets a small monthly salary. The family runs a small-scale agricultural business. Specifically, they own a vineyard and a plot of land where they grow haricot. The harvested grapes and haricot are sold at the local open market and among her villagers. The family has been in this business for five years, and they are very experienced in this field. Marine is a very hardworking woman, running the family business and also doing housekeeping. With this credit, Marine wants to build a kitchen in her house so she can cook comfortably for her family. She wants to buy building materials and kitchen supplies. This loan will help the family to improve their lives and live in a better environment.

loans.use: to buy building materials for building a kitchen

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a 34-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol, Philippines. She has three children. The oldest is 17 years old and the youngest is nine. Amelita has been engaged in the farming business for 20 years now together with her husband. She earns 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month. This is the source of her income.

Amelita is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and medicine, which will be used in her farm to raise healthy crops. Through this loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizer and medicine so that she can harvest good crops in time.

In the future, Amelita hopes to expand her business. She also wants to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicine for her farming business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 64 years old and married, with four children.

Jesusa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell.

Jesusa has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Jesusa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has been farming for 4 years. His primary income sources are milk, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Milking the cow for milk production!' His biggest challenge, he says, is that he lacks funds to diversify his agriculture ventures. Animals on the farm have been given the names of Browny and Nyeusi.

Joseph was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied that he heard about Juhudi from a relative. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He learned 'how one can use microfinance loans to do business, especially agri-business.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Joseph replied, 'I will start poultry keeping with the intent of producing and selling eggs, thus increasing income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joseph owns a cow but does not own poultry, a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito netting but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Benedicta, who is in her late 40s, is single, with a boy who is an adult and who has completed his college studies. 

For a period of three years now, she has been running a cross-border business, selling clothes to specific customers. She has no business premises and no specific working time.  Whenever she buys her products, she delivers them straight to the customers' premises, according to their orders.

This will be her 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. She used the previous loans to buy a three-wheel motorcycle (Bajaji), increased her stocks of clothes, and started building her house. She has successfully paid back all of her loans. 

She will use this loan to finish building her house. Her dream is to one day be able to open another business, so as to expand her portfolio. 

Benedicta will share this loan with her loan group, "Msakuzi," which totals 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Cheikh est un homme marié et père de trois enfants.Il tient une boutique d'alimentation dans son quartier.Il vend des denrées alimentaires comme le riz, le sucre , le lait...Son commerce lui permet de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretein de sa famille et de subvenir à certains de ses besoins.Afin de renforcer son stock, il sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter des produits alimentaires.
texts.en: Cheikh is a married man and the father of 3 children. He owns a grocery shop in his district. He sells food like rice, sugar and milk. His business enables him to take care of his family's living expenses and to cover some of his own needs. He is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs in order to buy food items and strengthen his inventory.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Milton Xavier

texts.es:
El Sauce es un pequeño pueblo ubicado al occidente de Nicaragua sumergido entre montañas florecidas y ríos caudalosos que mantienen un clima fresco y un paisaje bello que todo visitante queda enamorado de él, además por la nobleza y hospitalidad de sus habitantes.

 En este maravilloso lugar nació y creció el joven Milton Xavier, soltero de 27 años que estudió la carrera de Ciencias de la Educación y que hoy se desempeña como maestro de primaria en una escuela rural de dicho municipio, donde imparte clases a niños humildes de escasos recursos. 
Cabe señalar que Milton se caracteriza por ser noble y ayudar a estos niños quienes necesitan tanto el apoyo de los demás.

Una de sus grandes necesidades en este momento es tramitar su título universitario con el fin de tener un mejor status social y económico porque con éste mejoraría sus ingresos, por tal razón está solicitando un crédito para pagar esos trámites y sacar lo más pronto posible dicho título porque su salario no alcanza para llevar a cabo su objetivo además porque estos trámites son demasiados de caros.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a small town located in the western part of Nicaragua between flourishing mountains and swift rivers, which maintain the fresh climate and beautiful landscapes that make every visitor fall in love with it, not to mention the nobility and hospitality of its inhabitants.

The young man Milton Xavier was born and grew up in this marvelous place.  He is single and is twenty-seven years old.  He studied for a Sciences in Education degree and today works as a primary school teacher in a rural school in this same town.  He teaches humble children who come from scarce resources.  It should be noted that Milton is characterized as being noble in helping these children who need a lot of support from others.    

One of his greatest needs in this moment is to process his university degree, with the end result of having a better social and economic status; this process would improve his income.  

He is requesting a loan in order to pay for this paperwork and processing, and to do it as soon as possible, since his salary is not enough to cover this.  These processing fees are very expensive.

loans.use: to pay for the paperwork and processing fees for his university degree.

loans.name: Mbissine

texts.fr: Madame Mbissine  habite au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 05 ans. Elle pratique la vente de jus et de crème glacée. Elle est membre  de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 100.000 francs CFA. Elle  dispose d’un petit réfrigérateur qui ne lui permet pas de satisfaire la demande globale de sa clientèle. Par conséquent  son financement sera utilisé pour l’achat d’un réfrigérateur plus grand qui lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité de vente.  En effet, l’accroissement de ses revenus pourra lui donner la possibilité d’améliorer les conditions alimentaire et le bien être de sa famille. Elle souhaite devenir une grande commerçante grâce à une diversification de sa  gamme de produits à offrir a sa clientèle.
texts.en: Mbissine lives in Senegal. She is married and has been a retailer for over 5 years. She sells juice and ice cream. She is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches, where she is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs. She owns a small fridge which does not enable her to satisfy her customers' general demand. Therefore, her loan will be used to buy a larger fridge which will allow her to increase her sales capacity. An increase in her revenue would allow her to improve her family's nutrition and well-being. She would like to become a large retailer by diversifying the range of products on offer to her clientèle.

loans.use: to buy a larger fridge.

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny is a new client and a first time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI).  He is 27 years old and has two dependents, whose parents reside in Tonny's former village.  Tonny’s primary source of income is riding a motorcycle and transporting people to different destinations.  This has enabled him to pay tuition for the two dependents, to pay rent for their house, and to make payment for land.  

The purpose for the loan is to settle the outstanding balance on the land purchase (shown in photo).  He would like to see the dependents study to the highest level of education attainable.  He thinks if they study they will have a better future since his lack of education has forced him into riding a motorcycle, which is a hard way of living.  On the land he would like to build a simple residence, thus saving rent money in order to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds and to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.ru:
Абдукаюм мужчина в возрасте 35 лет. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. Дети ходят в школу. Жена работает в столовой, посудомойщицей. Сам Абдукаюм работает на стройке. Но то что они вместе с женой зарабатывают все уходит на проживание. Несколько лет тому назад они начали строить дом но из за не хватки денежных средств приостановили стройку. Единственным хорошим доходом в их семье является откармливание скота. Этим делом Абдукаюм занимается почти с детство. Знает все преимущество этого дела. Он планирует развивать этот бизнес и на прибыль наконец то достроить свой дом. Жена тоже помогает ему в этом деле. На данный момент у него закончился корм для скота, сейчас зима и травы почти негде нет.
 Поэтому Абдукаюм обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой, планирует на полученный кредит купить корм для скота. Он выражает свою благодарность Арванд, за то что с помощью таких организаций люди нуждающиеся в денежных средствах могут осуществить свои планы.
texts.en: Abdukayum is 35 years old and is married with two children.  His children are still in school and his wife works in a cafeteria as a dishwasher.  Abdukayum works in the building trade, but everything that he and his wife earn together goes to pay for their living expenses.  A few months ago, they started to build a home, but they had to halt construction due to lack of funds.  The one solid source of income in the family is cattle raising.  Abdukayum has been involved in this line of work practically since childhood.  He knows all the advantages of this line of work.  His plan is to increase his business so he can use the income to finally finish the work on his home.  His wife also helps him in this task.  At the moment, the feed for the animals is running out since it is winter, there is hardly any grass anywhere.  This is why Abdukayum has turned to Arvand for financial support.  He plans to use his loan to buy feed for his animals.  He sends his thanks to Arvand, because it is through the assistance of their organization that people in need of financial help can fulfill their plans.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou  vit au Sénégal. C’est une femme marié qui évolue dans le secteur commerciale depuis plus de 30 ans. Elle s’adonne a la vente de poissons. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de  participer  aux dépenses quotidiennes de son foyer. Elle est membre  de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle a  déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur.  Elle sollicite un prêt de 200.000 francs CFA dans le but d’acheter des poissons destinés à la revente. Son objectif consiste à accroitre son offre de produits pour accroitre ses bénéfices. Par conséquent, l’augmentation de ses ressources financières lui permettra de renforcer son fond roulement  pour satisfaire la demande globale de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Seynabou lives in Senegal. She is a married woman who has been working in the retail sector for over 30 years. She specialises in selling fish. The revenues generated by her business allow her to contribute to her household's daily expenditures. She is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches, where she has already repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs in order to buy fish for resale. Her aim is to increase her product offerings in order to increase her profits. An increase in her financial resources will therefore enable her to strengthen her working capital and satisfy her customers' general demand.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Geruncia

texts.en:
Geruncia works hard to support her family. Geruncia is married and has a buy-and-sell, generic medicine business in the Philippines.

Geruncia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of generic medicine to sell. Geruncia has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Geruncia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of generic medicine to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 51 years old and married with three children.  She is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines.  Evangeline requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  In the future, Evangeline would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en: Girlie is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She has been running a store business over the years and has obtained a lot of experience and regular customers. Now, she is requesting a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to purchase vinegar, soy sauce, soap and shampoo inventory for her grocery store, in expectation of increased demand during the summer. She is a hard-working, welcoming, and modest woman.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, soy sauce, soap and shampoo for her business.

loans.name: Abdurahaman

texts.en:
Abdurahaman has been doing well in his business, which has expanded, and he is able to get more income compared to before. His family is doing well, and he is happy that he is able to provide for their needs.

This marks his third loan, which he will use to buy more coconuts for resale, and thus, expand his coconut and palm leaves stock. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay his loan. 

He hopes to live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en: Melita is 45 years old and is married to Wilfred. To raise her children, Melita is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been in this business for three years and usually earns about 2,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) per piglet. At this time, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for her hog-raising business. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Liwanag

texts.en: Liwanag raises hogs and has been in this business for almost five years.  She is 49 years old and married with six children.  She was able to raise all of her children through her determination and hog business.  At this time, Liwanag is taking out a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccine for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for her hogs.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty, a hardworking mother of three children, is 43 years old and married. Her children are all attending school at the college and high school levels. Before they were married, Liberty's husband started a business making hollow blocks, an enterprise Liberty now participates in as his partner. It is their sole source of income.

Liberty wants to get higher profits from the business to sustain her children's needs in school and reach her dream of someday owning an elf truck. She is therefore requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy sand and cement to make more blocks.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to make hollow blocks.

loans.name: Lesalon

texts.en:
Lesalon is a 30-year-old, single gentleman who supports a family of four dependents. He operates a posho mill business where he grinds cereals, like maize, into flour and sells the same at a profit. He has been in this business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

This will be his third loan. He plans to purchase bags of maize for milling into flour. He plans to use anticipated profits to reinvest for expansion. His future dream is to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase maize for his posho mill business.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells phone accessories.

To help expand her business, Debora has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to stock more accessories to sell; this will help Debora to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brother. She hopes that in the future she will be able to have a well-established business.

Debora is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more accessories to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items for her cafeteria business. Rosalinda has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from selling fruits and vegetables. Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her cafeteria

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie manages a wine-making business, a piggery and a farming business. She has two hectares of rice field and raises six sows, 12 fattening pigs and 20 piglets. According to her, she stands as both father and mother to six children since her husband died due to an accident. Annie's focus and determination pushes her to strive to improve her businesses.

Annie's main goal is to increase her sales and profit. To achieve all her goals, she is asking for additional capital in the amount of PHP 30,000 which will be used in purchasing sugar, empty bottles, and 'bignay' fruit for her wine-making business. She knows that through the amount she's requesting, she could be able to develop her wine-making business and become a popular manufacturer of wines within her locality and nearby municipality.

Annie believes that her sacrifices and patience will lead her to become a better entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, empty bottles, and 'bignay'  fruit for her wine-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock for resale

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Felipe works hard to support his family.

He has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a cafeteria. Felipe is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items to sell in his general store, like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, and eggs.

Felipe has been sustaining his business activities through the past 13 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help attain his dream to save enough money, so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in his general store, like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, and eggs.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
La Sra.  María vive en Libertad, tiene 35 años de edad. Ella empezó vendiendo gelatina y flan; luego fue incrementando el negocio poco a poco. 

Hasta ahora tiene una tienda general de víveres. En su negocio trabaja sola todo el día. Teme enfermarse por lo que vive sola y no tiene a quien acudir en caso de emergencia.

No está casada, no tiene hijos a quien mantener pero con las fuerzas de Dios sigue adelante día a día sin darse por vencida, tiene sueños y anhelos que desea cumplir.

Con el préstamo solicita comprar más mercadería como legumbres, viveres, bebidas para así poder surtir más su tienda o negocio, para mayores ingresos de capital y con ello poner también un bazar  y sobre todo su propia familia.
texts.en:
María, 35, lives in Libertad.  She started out selling gelatin and custard and gradually added to the business.  To date, she has a general food store.  She works by herself every day.  She fears getting sick because she lives alone and has no one to turn to in an emergency.  She’s not married and has no children to support but with God’s strength she continues forward day to day never giving up; she has dreams and hopes to fulfill.

She wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise like vegetables, foodstuffs and beverages to better stock her store to earn higher income so that she can eventually open a clothing store and above all have a family of her own.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
This is Cristita, 46, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a tricycle driver, and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cristita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also has a food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 16,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Cristita hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams that her business will grow bigger.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Celsa

texts.en:
Ma. Celsa is a 65-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is a mother of a grown-up son. Ma. Celsa is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Ma. Celsa is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Ma. Celsa has hopes of making their fishing business a success and sustainable. She also wants to save money so that she can repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is 39 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in the small village of Telavi district, East Georgia. Her husband works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. Nana is involved in a sales business. In particular, she purchases used clothing to resell among her villagers. Along with her trading business, Nana has two pigs and sells piglets. Nana is a very hard-working woman with a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan for purchasing a stock of used clothing to resell among her villagers. She plans to reinvest the income in her business for further development. Nana awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of used clothing to resell among her villagers

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline has since cleared her first loan and her electronics business is doing well. She has since employed someone to manage the business.

She has now diversified to dairy farming and milk sales and, as such, this second loan will facilitate her in buying an additional dairy cow. She plans to use the anticipated profits to set up a milk shop.  Her dream is to acquire financial sustainability.

loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow as she diversifies into dairy farming.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has since paid off her previous loans and from the proceeds leased an additional piece of land where she has planted maize. 

She has applied for a third loan of Kes 90,000 from KADET which she plans to use to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for the growing crops. She hopes to use the increased proceeds to pay school fees for her children. 

Her dream is to own a large maize plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Alvaro Ramon

texts.es:
Alvarado vive en Libertad, tiene 24 años de edad. El empezó su negocio aprendiendo hacer bloques desde muy pequeño; después poco a poco se puso su propio negocio para así adquirir mayor ingreso. Actualmente su trabajo de venta de bloques es su sustento de día a día ya que lo realiza con dos personas trabajando así todo el día.

Su dificultad es su enfermedad el cual en este momento la tiene controlada porque aparte cobra un dinero de lo que entrega.

El cliente no está casado, no tiene hijos a quien mantener así que se mantiene solo, el mismo paga sus gastos y se compra lo que él quiere.

Con este préstamo quiere poder comprar arena, cementos para vender mas bloques.Alvarado quiere que su negocio siga creciendo día a día hasta ponerse su propio DISENSA (una empresa de venta de materiales de construcción).
texts.en:
Alvarado, 24, lives in Libertad.  He started the business having learned how to make concrete blocks when still a boy.  He gradually started his own business to earn higher income.  Currently, his work selling concrete blocks is his source of daily support; he works all day with two people.
