His difficulty is his illness which at the moment is under control.  He also collects the money he charges for what he delivers.  He’s not married and has no children to support but so he supports himself; he pays his own expenses and buys what he wants.

He wants to use this loan to buy sand and cement in order to sell more blocks.  Alvarado wants his business to continue growing every day so that he can open his own branch of DISENSA (a firm that sells construction supplies).

loans.use: to buy raw materials like sand, cement and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Famil

texts.en:
Famil is 33 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children in a small village of Marneuli district. The family runs an agricultural business and has milk cows and calves. They produce cheese with the milk and sell it locally.

The main income for the family is his newly started grocery store, selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to further develop. Several times he has asked for loans from local financial institutions to develop his business, but without success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of their low income. 

Famil’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Famil will cover the cost of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request. He plans to increase the turnover in his business gradually. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Famil will work hard, and he will be able to improve living conditions for his family. With this loan, his family will generate enough income to access regular available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event that they need it and also Famil will renovate his house which is old and damaged.

loans.use: To buy more stock of groceries for his newly started store

loans.name: Chemutai

texts.en:
Chemutai has already cleared her previous loan, owing to the good harvest for the last season. She has since leased an extra ten acres of land where she has planted maize. 

She has been advanced a third loan of Kes 90,000 which will facilitate her in the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides as well as pay for the increased labour. She hopes to use the proceeds to build a permanent house for the family as well as pay school fees for her children.

She hopes in future  to own large maize and wheat plantations.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and  wheat and maize seeds

loans.name: Benedete

texts.en:
Benedete is a 38-year-old, green grocer and a single mother of two, from Voi, Kenya. She has been in the green grocery business for the last ten years and her income is great. 

This will be her fifth loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) and she will use the money to purchase more stocks of green vegetables for her grocery business and use the anticipated profit to pay her children's fees. She hopes to have a prosperous family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of green vegetables for her grocery business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 40 years old and married with three children who are in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, soft drinks, spices, noodles, etc. Evelyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, soft drinks, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another motorbike and to open up a new shop

loans.name: Mwinyi

texts.en:
Mwinyi is a 39-year-old, fresh juice vendor and greengrocer in Mombasa. He is married, and he and his wife support three children. He has been in business for the past ten years, and his income is great.

This marks his second loan in KADET, after having repaid the first one successfully. He will use the new loan money to purchase more fruits for making fresh juices, and more green vegetables for his grocery sales. He plans to use the profit to expand his grocery business and to pay school fees for his children. 

He hopes to expand more and more in his business, and to have a happy family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fruits and green vegetables, for his fruit juice and greengrocery sales business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has since cleared her previous loan owing to good milk sales from her livestock. 

She has applied for her third loan which will facilitate the purchase of fertilizers, pesticides as well as pay for the labor of weeding her larger piece of land. She plans to use the anticipated profits to buy more of dairy cows, as well as pay school fees for her children. 

Her dream is to be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides as well as pay for the labor of weeding her land.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 67-year-old married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 18 years to 40 years. She describes herself as an ambitious and determined woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a densely populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of cereals. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy cereals to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier of cereals within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Mercy Santa

texts.es:
Mercy vive en Libertad, tiene 45 años. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa. Empezó vendiendo a amigos y luego compro mas mercaderías para así poder vender a otras personas. En la actualidad el trabajo lo realiza sola todo el tiempo.

La dificultad que tiene seria enfermarse, pero si se enferma el esposo como trabaja, podría ayudarla pagándole los medicamentos que necesite.

Está casada tiene una niña pequeña de siete meses, su esposo trabaja siendo chofer de una cooperativa así ambos 
se ayudan para tener un mejor vivir, y a poder sacar a su hija adelante.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar blusas, pantalones, interiores. El sueño que tiene la clienta con el préstamo es el de poder tener su negocio propio de ropa y que así pueda crecer poco a poco, para así tener mayores ingresos y mejores capitales.
texts.en:
Mercy, 45, lives in Libertad.  She has a business selling clothes.  She started out selling to friends and then bought more merchandise in order to be able to sell to other people too.  She currently works alone all the time.  The difficulty she has would be becoming ill but if she were to do so her husband works and would be able to pay for any medicine she’d need.

She’s married and has a seven-month-old daughter; her husband works as a driver for a cooperative so they both help each other out to live better and to be able to move their daughter forward.

She wants to use the loan to buy blouses, pants and underwear.  Her dream for the loan is to be able to have her own clothing business so she can gradually grow to earn higher income and better capital.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has one child. She has been farming for five years and her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

Her dairy operation is what is most enjoyable about farming.  Her biggest challenge is to make sales in far market places since those nearby offer low prices.

Joan was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'efficiency.'  This client also learned about savings for future use during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session.

Her highest monthly expense are family expenses. She said the loan will benefit her family by improving their quality of  life.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joan owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 49 years old, married to a tricycle driver and blessed with two children. They are currently residing at the village of Rang Ay. She has managed a fish-selling business for almost 20 years. From this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 10,000 a month. She would like a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase 40 kilos of fish. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted to be able to gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase 40 kilos of fish

loans.name: Lovince

texts.en: Lovince lives in Les Cayes, the capital of the South Department of Haiti. He has had a business in the city for 3 years and is now looking to expand his business to sell clean energy products. He is really interested in selling Lanp Enèji Pwòp as well solar desk lamps and the Recho Gaz Blan (a type of cookstove). He has been a dedicated clean energy entrepreneur ever since and he lacks the capital to grow his business. In this case, with a Kiva loan; Lovince will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills. He has been working with Enèji Pwop as retailer since the beginning of Enèji Pwòp Expansion Program and he would like to continue to be a part of the team.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Alivita

texts.en:
Alivita is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by raising and selling livestock, and buying and selling fruits, in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. Alivita has been raising and selling livestock for one year, and she earns additional income from buying and selling fruits.

Alivita successfully paid back her previous loan. Now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her caring for livestock and fruit-selling business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Hugues

texts.en:
Hugues lives in Rendel, in the South Department of Haiti, an area with erratic access to electricity. He has had a store for 5 years that sells recharge card and recharge cell phone with inverter. He has recently decided to start selling EarthSpark clean energy products to expand his current business.

With a Kiva loan, Hugues will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills. Hugues would like to sell solar energy desk lamps with mobile phone charging capability. He wants to sell clean energy products because he likes business and the local population really likes EarthSpark products. He is married and has 12 children in school. Rendel is very vulnerable to flooding due to deforestation.

loans.use: to pay for stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Patricia Mariana

texts.es:
Patricia vive en Libertad, tiene 42 años de edad. Ella desde muy pequeña siempre a vendida ropa y joyas, ese ha sido su sustento hasta la actualidad, el trabajo lo realiza sola en la mañana hasta la tarde, vendiendo blusas, pantalones, interiores, etc.

La dificultad que cruza es su enfermedad pero ella depende demasiado del negocio porque ese es lo que la hace seguir adelante, no invierte todo el dinero en ropa se deja un capital para pagar las cosas de la casa.

Es una mujer soltera con un hijo de cinco años que estudia en una escuela fiscal, su hijo es el poder de ella para que cada día se esfuerce mas en las cosas que hace.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar blusas, pantalones, interiores. El sueño que quiere poder realizar con este préstamo es el de que su negocio siga creciendo para así tener mayores ingresos, ya que es sola y sola mantiene a su hijo.
texts.en:
Patricia, 42, lives in Libertad.  She’s been selling clothes and jewelry since she was very little.  It’s been her means of support to date.  She works alone from morning till evening selling blouses, pants, underwear, etc.  The difficulty she’s going through is her illness but she depends on her business very much so this makes her continue moving forward.  She does not invest all her money in clothes; she sets aside some of the capital to pay for things for her house.

She’s single and has a five-year-old son attending public school; her son is the motivating force behind her daily efforts.  She wants to use the loan to buy blouses, pants and underwear.  The dream she wants to reach with this loan is that he business continues growing in order to earn higher income since she’s her son’s sole source of support.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants and underwear.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en: Franklin lives in Port a Piment, Haiti, an area with erratic access to electricity. He has a degree in accounting. He would now like to launch his first business by becoming an EarthSpark Clean Energy Entreprenuer. With a Kiva loan, Franklin will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  He is looking for a loan to purchase stock for solar desk lamp as well as kerosene stoves and charcoal-efficient cookstoves because these are the products most in demand in his area. He does’nt like to see someone cut down tree, by selling these stoves can help minimize the effects of charcoal on the environment by reducing carbon emissions and the need to cut down trees to produce charcoal.

loans.use: to pay for stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a married, 63-year-old woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has three grown children. She has been engaged in selling beef in her local market for 12 years now. She earns 5000 PHP monthly as her only source of income. 
Catalina is requesting a loan to pay for her business permit and to buy more meat to sell. Through this loan, she will be able to process her business permit with the fees so that she can have a location and can sell meat in the market.
In the future, Catalina hopes to expand her business .

loans.use: to pay for her business permit and to buy more meat  to sell

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas owns a variety store, refreshment stall and Internet cafe. He has been running his refreshment stall for five years and earns about PHP15,000.He uses his income to support his Internet cafe stall, refreshment stall and daily commodities and allowances for his two children.

Jonas would like to increase his fresh coconut juice supply having sold out of it. He is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000. He knows that through this loan, he could gain more income and re-stock his variety store.J onas is hoping for approval of his requested loan amount in order for him to have a comfortable living condition and earn greater profits.

loans.use: to buy more coconut for his refreshment stall and grocery items for his variety store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a buy-and-sell coconut shell business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of coconut shell to sell. Nenita has been in this business for 13 years now. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of coconut shell to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata habite au Sénégal. C’est une femme mariée qui s’adonne a la coiffure et a la vente de tissus et parfums et autres produits cosmétiques  depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle gère son propre salon de coiffure. Elle est membre  de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 200.000 francs CFA. Ce crédit sera utilisé  pour acheter des tissus, des parfums  et  des produits cosmétiques pour les besoins de son salon de coiffure. Son objectif est  de satisfaire au maximum  la demande de sa clientèle. Elle espère aussi pouvoir renforcer son fond de roulement grâce à l’accroissement de ses bénéfices. Elle projet  futur consiste a  acquérir un nouveau salon plus grand, d’une très grande notoriété.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been a hairdresser while also selling fabrics, perfumes and other cosmetic products for over five years. She runs her own beauty salon. 

She is a member of a local U-IMCEC branch where she is seeking a loan of 200,000 FCFA to stock up on fabrics, perfumes, and beauty products for her business. Her goal is to fully meet customer demand. She also hopes that an increase in her profits will help to strengthen her working capital. 

In the long term, she wants to own a larger, highly popular beauty shop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, perfumes and beauty products for resale in her salon.

loans.name: Luís Azamat

texts.es:
El Sauce es un pueblo donde abunda la leche y la miel por la naturaleza de sus tierras que son aptas para la actividad, la mayoría de sus habitantes elaboran alimentos que se derivan de la leche y la miel para sobrevivir.

En este pueblo lleno de bondades nació el joven Luís Azamat criado con costumbres tradicionales meramente del municipio.

 Estudió la carrera de Ingeniería civil porque le fascina construir edificios para el bien común.

 Se desempeña como tal para una empresa del estado donde tiene varios años de laborar y donde su actividad principal es construir casas para las personas de escasos recursos.

En la actualidad tiene la necesidad de un crédito para pagar un curso universitario con el fin de estar más preparado de acuerdo a la tecnología y por ser éste muy caro no puede cubrirlo con su salario.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a town where milk and honey are in abundance due to the nature of its land which are perfect for agricultural activity. The majority of the town's inhabitants survive by producing foodstuffs which derive from said milk and honey. It was in this bountiful town that the young Luis Azamat was born and grew up with the traditional local customs. 

Luis began studying civil engineering because he desires to construct buildings for the good of the community. He now works for a state-owned company where he has worked for a number of years, primarily building homes for people with low resources. 

He is currently applying for a loan in order to pay for university coursework so that he is better prepared and up-to-date with industry technology. The coursework is very expensive and he cannot cover the cost with his salary alone.

loans.use: to pay for university coursework.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 54 years old. He lives in Akhmeta district with his wife and two children. His daughter works as a sales lady in local market and gets a monthly income. 

Otar is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he brings wood from the forest with his own tractor. He cuts the wood properly, to be sold locally, at a good price. Otar is a very hard-working man and does his best to improve their living conditions. 

He requested a loan for purchasing tires, as the existing tires are worn and Otar has stopped working. After the tires are renovated, he will continue selling wood and, thus, increase the income of the family. With increased income, he will improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his tractor in order to continue working.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has four children. Ama is a food vendor. She cooks rice, fish, and stew for sale at Elmina, which she has done for the past four years now. Her husband is a painter. Ama uses her income to help support her husband in paying the family's general utility bills. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase more bags of rice and other ingredients she will use to prepare her food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to further grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice and other ingredients she will use to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en: Mable is a second time borrower at UGAFODE Micro finance Ltd (MDI) applying for Ugx.400,000. She is single mother with four children whose school fees she pays. She stays with her children at their family home in one of the outskirts of the Kampala suburbs. Her primary source of income is frying snacks such as Cassava and pan cakes from her home. She has applied for this loan to boost her business. She will also use part it to help pay tuition for the children. She works so hard with a goal of supporting all her children throughout their schooling.Despite the financial constraints, she is determined that none of her children will drop out of school.With financial assistance from UGAFODE, she hopes to purchase land and build a residential structure on it for herself and children.In the photo above Mable is with the UGAFODE Credit officer who had gone to verify her business.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil and cassava for making snacks.

loans.name: Nana Esi

texts.en: Nana Esi is a petty trader. She sells a variety of goods including: notebooks, pencils, pens, and crayons. She also sells a variety of tasty soft drinks. Nana Esi sells her goods under a tree near a primary school at Nkontrodo near Elmina. She has done this work for the past 15 years. She is married with 8 children. Nana Esi uses her income to support her husband in the general up keep of their home. She will use her loan to purchase more stationary, writing utensils and soft drinks to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Nana Esi plans to build a store to sell her goods.

loans.use: purchase more stationary, writing utensils, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
José tiene 33 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía ocho años de edad, pues su padre siempre le decía que tenía que aprender. También, aprendió a manejar maquinaria agrícola, gracias a un amigo que conoció a los 14 años de edad. Hoy en día esa es su fuente de ingresos; manejar maquinaria pesada. Cuando tiene sus días libres, se va junto con unos amigos a pescar al mar, de manera que en su hogar no falte el alimento diario. Cuando va  a trabajar en la agricultura debe caminar una hora para llegar al terreno. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar el alquiler de 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, comprar media bolsa de semilla de maíz y tres sacos de abono. La inversión le ayudara muchísimo, debido a que se le presento una dificultad y ocupo el dinero disponible para la siembra y con el préstamo podrá sembrar para que no falte el alimento en su casa. Su propósito es, ahorrar para comprarse unas cuatro vacas y poder tener su propio establo, que sus hijos puedan estudiar y que sean unos profesionales, pues él no tuvo esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old, married and has two children.  He has been a farmer since he was eight years old because his father always told him that he needed to learn.  He also learned to drive farming machinery, thanks to a friend he met when he was 14.  Now this is his source of income; operating heavy machinery.  When he has free time he and his friends go to the sea to fish so that there is no shortage of food in his home.  When he goes to farm he must walk for an hour to reach his farmland.

He will use the money from this loan, through Fundación Campo, to rent 7,000 square meters of land, to buy half a sack of corn seed and three sacks of fertilizer.  This investment will help him greatly, because he had some difficulties and he used all of his money on planting.  He will be able to plant more with the money from this loan, so that there will be food in the home.  He wants to buy four cows so he can have his own stable and so that his sons can go to school and have professional careers because he didn’t have that opportunity.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Jinalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jinalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish dealer business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling cosmetics. Jinalyn is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish dealer business.

Jinalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a widow who has 10 children. In the photo above, she is standing behind the groceries that she sells in Elmina, a fishing community near Cape Coast. Efua uses her income to support her large family's well-being on her income alone. Efua will use the loan to procure a greater quantity and variety of groceries to sell. She hopes that a greater diversity of goods in her shop will attract new customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to build another shop in the future.

loans.use: procure other types of groceries

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana vive en Guayaquil, tiene 58  años de edad. Ella empezó su tienda porque pasaba mayor tiempo en su casa y queria pasar mas tiempo con sus hijos. Debido a que quería mayores ingresos fue incrementando su negocio poco a poco hasta adquirir ponerse una tienda.

El trabajo lo realiza con su esposo de 6:00 de la mañana hasta 21:00 de la noche, lo que le preocupa en toda su vida son las enfermedades tanto de ella como la de sus hijos. 	

Está casada, su esposo es chofer, y tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad quienes son el esfuerzo de la clienta para que sigan adelante. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar gaseosas, viveres, confites para su tienda. El sueño de la clienta con este préstamo es el de poder incrementar mas su negocio para así poder tener mayores ingresos de dinero.
texts.en:
Ana is 58 years old and lives in Guayaquil. She opened this store because she wanted to spend more time at home with her children. Ana wanted to earn more income and gradually increased her business until she was able to acquire her own store.

She and her husband work from 6:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. Her main concern throughout her entire life is dealing with her own illnesses and those of her children. Ana is married and her husband is a chauffeur. They have two grown children who are the reason behind her efforts to move forward.

With this loan, Ana will buy sodas, food products, and snacks for her store. Her dream is to use this loan to increase her business even more so that she will have more income.

loans.use: to buy sodas, food products, and snacks.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is 33 years old and single. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, generating additional income for her parents.

Julie Ann has a general store business in the Philippines. Julie Ann requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like soap, canned goods, eggs, spices, biscuits, and bread.

Julie Ann has been in this business for five years. In the future, Julie Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like soap, canned goods, eggs, spices, biscuits, and bread.

loans.name: Mariuxi Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mariuxi vive en las Orquídeas, tiene 21 años de edad. Ella es vendedora de cometicos como rimel, lapiz de labios y ojos, bases liquidas y en polvos. Ya que el comercio si deja ganancia y también le facilita para estar más tiempo en su hogar junto a sus hijos.

Este trabajo lo realiza sola en diferentes horarios, sale a venderles a sus clientes de casa en casa, para así poder pagar los gastos del hogar y el estudio de su hijo.

Teme enfermarse por lo que es una mujer separada de su esposo, que sola lucha por sacar adelante a su hijo que es menor de edad y que estudia en una escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo Mariuxi quiere comprar remedios para sus hijos y un 20% poder invertir en más cosas para vender sus productos. Y así poder obtener mejores ingresos de dinero.
texts.en:
Mariuxi is 21 years old and lives in Las Orquídeas. She sells cosmetics like mascara, lipstick, eye pencils, and liquid and powder foundation. This business is profitable and also helps her to have more time in her home with her children. 

She carries out this work alone at different hours. She goes out house to house selling to her customers so that she can pay for her household expenses and her child's studies.  

She is afraid of getting sick as she is separated from her husband and struggles alone to get her child ahead as he is a minor and attends public school.

With this loan, Mariuxi wants to buy medicines for her children and invest 20% in items in order to sell her products. This way she will be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and personal use products

loans.name: Erwin Ruben

texts.es:
Erwin nació en Guayaquil tiene 28 años. El cliente es oriundo de la Comuna del Puerto del Morro Inca (en Playas) que desde hace 11 años trabaja en la pesca y comercialización de mariscos.

Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 9:00am hasta las 5:00pm. En la venta de pescado. El cliente está casado, tiene tres hijos que estudian en una escuela particular y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos. 

Con el préstamo requiere  comprar medicinas y tratamiento medico para su familia, ya que el quiere que ellos esten con buena salud porque son su incentivo diario.
texts.en:
Erwin was born in Guayaquil, and he is 28 years old.  He is from the commune of Puerto del Morro Inca (in Playas).  For 11 years, he has been working selling fish and seafood. 

He works selling fish Mondays through Saturdays from 9am until 5pm.  He is married and has 3 children who attend a private school.  His wife devotes her time to the household chores.

With this loan, he needs to buy medicines and medical treatments for his family, because he wants them to be in good health, as they are his daily motivation in life.

loans.use: to buy medicines and medical treatments

loans.name: Hamilton Abel

texts.es:
Hamilton nació en Guayaquil. El negocio del cliente es dando clases de computación, este servicio lo empezó dando clases de computación en la universidad a sus compañeros, luego en un colegio fiscal, después de esto fue profesor de conducción; actualmente trabaja en la marina prestando servicios como profesor. 

El trabajo lo realiza solo de 9:00 – 19:00; dando clases de computación. Su dificultad de trabajo es la irregularidad de los censos como el traslado para su trabajo.     

No está casado, No tiene hijos. El cliente requiere del préstamo para comprar una laptop y materiales didacticos de enseñanza. 

En la entrevista Hamilton dijo:  Mi sueño es tener una academia de nivelacion o un cyber donde se enseñe a las personas. Y asi contribuir a la educacion y a la economia del pais. Otras de sus aspiraciones es tener una familia, con una esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Hamilton was born in Guayaquil. His business involves offering computer classes. Hamilton started providing these classes at the university to his co-workers. He then taught at a state school and was later named a formal instructor of computer science. At the moment, he works for the navy by providing his services as a teacher.

Hamilton works by himself from 9:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M., providing computer classes. His main challenge is dealing with the irregularity of his classes since he must travel for his job. Hamilton is not married and has no children. He is requesting a loan in order to buy a laptop computer and teaching materials.

When he was interviewed, Hamilton said, “My dream is to have either an academy or a cybercafé where I can teach people. In this way, I can contribute to the education and economy of my country. My other aspirations include having a family with a wife and children.”

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer and teaching materials.

loans.name: Yvrose

texts.en: Thanks to the support of Kiva lenders, Yvrose is applying for a new loan! After being funded on Kiva, Yvrose received a “business in a bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  She used this “business in a bag” to launch a clean energy entrepreneurship with EarthSpark. She sold out of her products so quickly that she has paid off her loan and is now coming back to us for another loan. This time, she would like to double her business and is asking for 1000 USD. With this money, she will continue to sell solar desk lamps and efficient stoves.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 58 years old and lives with his large family: his wife, who is unemployed, retired mother, three sons, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. 

Otar is a builder and works locally when he has opportunities with his sons. Regardless of their hard work, the monthly income is not enough to feed the nine-member family. 

With the requested loan, Otar wants to buy agricultural land. He will cultivate it and sow alfalfa (lucerne). The harvested product will be sold among local farmers, as alfalfa is a very necessary feed for cattle. 

This will increase income for the family, and Otar will be able to make his big family’s life better. He awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land and sow alfalfa (lucerne).

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She is engaged in a hog-fattening business. 

Right now, Merlita wants to borrow a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business. This would enable her to offer her family a better way of living.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is married and has seven children. She moves from market to market around the area of Elmina to sell salted fish, vegetables, okra, garden eggs, and others items. Adjoa has been selling food this way for ten years now. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of their home and children. 

She wants to increase the quantity and variety of goods and food she sells in the market and hopes to use her loan for this very purpose. Any new income realized from her expanded business will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to increase the quantity and variety of goods and food she sells in the markets.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, 49 years old, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. They are currently residing at the village of Rang-ay. She's been in the fish-selling business for almost 20 years, earning a net income of PHP 9,000 per month. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase 30 kilos of fish. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase 30 kilos of fish to sell.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 54 years old and single and she works very hard to provide for her parents.

Perlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, spices, cooking oil, soap, sugar, coffee, etc..

Perlita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Perlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, spices, cooking oil, soap, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is a 51-year-old married man from Garcia, Bohol. He has eight grown children. He is engaged in a fishing business and this is the source of his income.

Celso is requesting a loan to buy a fishing net. Through this loan, he can buy a new fishing net which will be used to catch fish which he can sell in his local community and earn a profit. In the future, Celso hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Maria Mylen

texts.en:
Maria Mylen has operated an eatery and variety store for 15 years. She is 37 years of age, happily married and blessed with two children. Her main priority at this time is to increase her sales and profit so she can improve her eatery and variety store.

Maria Mylen would like to take out a loan of PHP 30,000 allowing her to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, candies, assorted biscuits, various kinds of vegetables and raw meat for her food sales business. She hopes to get approval of her requested loan amount so she can secure her family's future and save for emergency purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, candies, assorted biscuits, various kinds of vegetables and raw meat for her food sales business.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 28 years old and has one infant-age child. She is a single parent who lives with her parents in a rural community. Due to lack of job opportunities, she is engaged in selling AVON products to generate income. Being kind and friendly, she was able to win more friends who became her customers. 

She plans to acquire more stocks of the said products to sell but she has not got enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional PHP 35,000 to buy more stocks of lotions, perfumes, roll-ons, lipsticks, face powders and underwear to sell. She believes that, someday, she will make further improvements in the business as she continues work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of lotions, perfumes, roll-ons, lipsticks, face powders and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells the traditional staple dish kenkey in Nkontrodo near the town of Elmina. Kenkey is a fermented maize dough that is a local favorite of many Ghanaian's. Aba has been selling kenkey for the past three years now. 

Aba is a widow and has four children. As a single parent, she is responsible for the general up-keep of her children and so uses her income to support her family and create a comfortable life for them. Whatever she has left, she saves for the future and reinvests in the business.  

Her loan will be used to buy maize for her corn dough and other necessary ingredients to produce her kenkey recipe. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business and meet her customers demands for her tasty dish.

loans.use: to buy maize for her corn dough and also to  produce kenkey.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has four children and has been doing this work for ten years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “harvesting!” Her biggest challenge is “drought that usually results in low production."

Rose was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: “efficiency.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: “record-keeping.”

Rose’s highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?”, Rose replied, “assist in payment of fees.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rose owns the following: “cow and poultry” but does not own: “pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.”

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a “mosquito net” but does not have “electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is a married woman and a mother of two young children aged six and five. She is engaged in a fishing business since her husband works as a fisherman. 

Ma. Delia is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch which will allow them to sell more fish in the market. In the future, Ma. Delia hopes to expand their business so that it will generate more income which is necessary for the needs of the family and for their children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
This is Tessie, 36, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She works hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. She also has a direct selling business where she sells merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

Tessie operates the buy and sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sell them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like shorts and ladies wear to expand her product inventory.

Tessie dreams of expanding her business and having other branches. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for shorts and ladies wear needed in her business.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has two children and has been doing farming work for ten years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'dairy farming!' Her biggest challenge is: 'high cost of feeds.' Animals on the farm have been given the name of: 'Null.'

Annah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'fair interest rates.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: 'record keeping.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Annah replied: 'better quality of life.' She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Annah owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle,' but does not own: 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net,' but does not have: 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Myagmarjalbuu

texts.en:
Myagmarjalbuu, 49 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their two room apartment. 

She has been running a clothes sales business for two consecutive years and in such a short time period, she succeeded in attracting numerous customers to her business. Before beginning this business, she had worked in Korea for about ten years on an employment contract. When she came back to Mongolia, she used her savings to begin running the clothes sales business. 

The apartment she and her husband live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair. Myagmarjalbuu is requesting a loan of MNT 2,000,000 to cover the costs of home repair, such as the purchasing of building materials and payments to workers. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the chilling coldness of wintertime. Myagmarjalbuu is a very hard-working and trustworthy individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of home repairs.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a single parent with one child. She sells footwear in Nkontrodo near the town of Elmina. Efua has done this work for the past five years now. As a single parent she uses her income to feed and clothe her child, and does this on her income alone.  

Efua will use her loan to purchase more footwear to sell in the markets. With the new profit from her expanded business Efua plans to continue to grow her business to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear to sell.

loans.name: Edwardson

texts.en:
Edwardson is married and has two children. He is operating a tricycle as a source of income. He tried to learn the said activity because of the poor living standards they had been experiencing. 

He wants to achieve a higher income in order to give a good life to his children. To make it possible, he is asking for assistance from the lenders through ASKI. He is asking for a loan amount of PHP 7,000 to purchase new tires and to pay for maintenance.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan owns and has operated her general store for three years. She is married having only one child. Joan's spouse is a police officer. Despite the fact that her spouse is police officer, Joan decide to generate her own income so they can have a better income someday.

Joan would like to complete the merchandise she offers in her general store so that her neighborhood customers will no longer pass by her store. With her determination to complete the merchandise she offers, she is asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP 5,000. She believes that this loan amount will enable her to gain better profit and customer satisfaction.

loans.use: to buy stocks of merchandise such as cases of soft drinks, eggs, ingredients and assorted biscuits for her general store.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa sells doughnuts, which she has done for five years. Adjowa is married and has seven children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying her children’s school fees. 

Adjowa will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnuts. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her doughnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for a sewing business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 20 years old and lives in Montserrado County; it has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single, with a five-year-old child that is in school and lives at home. 

She has been selling used clothes for a year now. She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is the profit she makes every day. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. In the future she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa  is a fishmonger; she buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them for sale. Adwowa has been selling smoked fish for four years now. She is married with three children. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  

Adwowa  will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell in the market. Adwowa will expand her business with the new profit from her loan.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is a married man, 54 year old, from Getafe, Bohol. He has eight grown children. He has engaged in the farming business for three years now. He usually earns PHP 5,000 per month. This is the source of his income. 

Domingo is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and nutrients. This will be used so his farm can have a healthy and productive growth. Through this loan, he will be able to make his crops healthy when harvest time comes. In the future, Domingo hopes to expand his business. He also wants to make his house a concrete one.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and nutrients for his farm.

loans.name: Bartolome

texts.en:
Bartolome is a hog raiser within his local community. He has been engaged in this kind of business for the past ten years. In addition to raising hogs, he also grows corn. Farming is the primary source of income of most families in this region due to the rolling landscape and mountainous characteristics.

Bartolome aspires to raise healthier hogs so he can sell them at higher prices. To do this, he is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs. Bartolome knows that his business will continue to grow smoothly because of the proper care and nutrition that he proves to his hogs.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines

loans.name: Berlinda's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members, Akosua and Belinda. They sell ‘wele’ and second hand clothes in the community respectively.

Akosua is a 39-year-old ‘wele’ (meat) seller who is married to Barffour, a 40-year-old trader. She has been with ID Ghana for the past year and she is doing very well. She has been in this business activity for three years now. She sells from Mondays to Saturdays. 

This is her second loan and she needs an amount of GHS 500 to buy more ‘wele’ to sell to her customers. She is grateful to ID Ghana. 

Akosua and Belinda need a total amount of GHS 1,200 to buy more to sell to their customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: To buy more 'wele' (meat) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area. She has three children and has been doing this work for twelve years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

Rael stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “generally farming as a whole," and stated the most challenging is "accessing funds to do farming."

Rael was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, “for farm loans.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session:  “the mandatory loaning process.”

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?”, Rael replied, “payment of fees.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rael owns the following: “cow, poultry, bicycle” but does not own: “pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile.” 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Rael has in the household “mosquito net and sewing machine” but does not have “electricity, solar power, running water, TV, DVD."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry and barbed wire in order to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Noriza

texts.en:
Noriza is a hard-working and industrious woman. She is friendly and business-oriented woman. She is young, and is married with two children. Her husband's occupation is a soldier. 

Noriza aims to make her retail store a stable source of income. But since her retail store is still in a crisis stage, Noriza is in need of financial support amounting to PHP 5,000. She will use this loan to buy eggs, cooking oil, assorted biscuits, sugar, milk, ingredients and soft drinks for her retail store. She knows that this loan will be really of great impact, most especially in increasing her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy eggs, cooking oil, assorted biscuits, sugar, milk, ingredients and soft drinks for her retail store.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Despite the hardship of living, Teresa is aiming for a happy and successful life. She is 47 years old and has five school-age children. She and her husband plan to continue sending their children to school so that they will become professionals in the future. 

In this regard, Teresa aims to improve her tailoring business to generate sufficient income. She is asking for an additional capital of PHP 25,000 to buy curtain cloth, needles and fabrics needed in her tailoring business. She is hoping that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy curtain cloth, needles and fabric needed in tailoring.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is 33 years old. He is single and lives in a small village of Tskaltubo District with his mother and a student brother. The family earns a living through their agricultural business. They have a plot of land, where nuts and maize are grown. In addition, the family members run a small dairy farm with a calf and three milk cows whose milk is used in cheese products. Ivane sells the cheese and harvested products locally. In addition, he works as a builder to earn a monthly income. 

Ivane has requested credit for the construction of greenhouses. His loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Ivane will purchase materials to construct greenhouses (iron pillars and polyethylene). He will grow greens and cucumbers in the greenhouses throughout the whole year. They will sell the harvested products on Kutaisi Market. The income of the family will significantly increase. They will be able to combat their poverty and in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to start up a greenhouse business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is divorced and has seven children. Ekua sells smoke  fish in and around the city of Elmina. She sells by moving from one market to another depending on the day of the week. She tries to go to all the big markets in the area to sell her fish and be the most successful. The income she makes from her sales is used to feed, clothe and educate her children. 

She will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits from her expanded fish enterprise, Ekua will grow her business further.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 28 years old and lives in Montserrado County; it has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children between three and 12, who are attending school and live at home. 

She has been selling dry fish for the past eight years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry fish for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad con un clima muy caluroso y poseedor de atractivos turísticos muy bellos e impresionantes, vive Julio, quien tiene 33 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador y desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlos, por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil. 

Día a día Julio trabaja como obrero agrícola y también tiene una parcela en la que actualmente ha sembrado tuna, el cual es una especie de cactus que tiene frutos de varios colores y son muy agradables, asimismo los ha infestado de cochinilla, la cual es una especie de insecto que vive en este tipo de plantas y del cual se obtiene una especie de tinte natural; él cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo porque le gusta lo que él hace.

Julio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando el podrá cubrir los gastos para realizar la cosecha de cochinilla ya que debe comprar espátulas y cepillos especiales para poder recolectar la cochinilla, de esta manera poder tener una mejor cosecha y sobre todo de manera adecuada, así el podrá tener mejores ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Julio, who is 33, lives in Nazca, a city with a very warm climate and very beautiful and impressive tourist attractions.  He is a very hardworking man who, from a very young age, learned to earn his daily bread with the sweat of his own brow, since his parents had few economic resources and he had to support them.  Therefore, he was only able to study until the age of 16, although he would have liked to study Civil Engineering.  

Julio works as a farm labourer every day and also has a plot of land on which he has sown tuna, a kind of cactus whose fruit is multi-coloured and very attractive.  Furthermore, his plants have become infested with mealy bugs, a type of insect which lives on these types of plants and from which a kind of natural dye is obtained.  

Julio believes that he is achieving success with his business because he is responsible and, above all, because he likes what he does.  He is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with the help that they provide, he can cover the costs of eradicating the mealy bugs, which involves buying special spatulas and brushes to collect them.  This will enable him to grow his crops in an appropriate way and have a better harvest, so he can boost his income and continue striving to realise his greatest ambition: “to improve his quality of life".

loans.use: to buy spatulas and brushes for eradicating mealy bugs

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Miguel está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza. Para poder medir cual es la situación de cada una.
Maria es parte de este grupo, y se dedica a la peluquería, se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que siempre hace muy buen servicio a sus clientes y eso la hace muy conocida y gracias a eso está creciendo. Es muy talentosa y por sobre todo le gusta mucho lo que hace.
Maria solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuague y demás, ya que esos son los productos que mas usa y con los que siempre brinda un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, named "San Miguel", is on its first loan cycle in the women's committee, where everybody works and helps each other to move ahead.  They are currently undergoing the poverty elimination survey to measure each of their individual situations.

María is part of this group and is a hairdresser.  She has a good customer base as she always gives her customers good service, making her known and her business grow.  She is very talented and, above all, the really enjoys what she does.

María is applying for this loan to invest in dyes, creams, shampoo, rinsing products and more.  These are the products she uses most and which she always uses to provide good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, rinsing products and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flour, wood and food-making ingredients for her food-selling business

loans.name: San Jose Obrero Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Jose Obrero está en su ciclo 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas ellas trabajan arduamente y se ayudan para poder, por medio del trabajo en conjunto, ayudar a sus familias a salir de la necesidad y privaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirian, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, que es rojo, es decir por debajo de la línea de la pobreza. Ella pese a esto tiene muchísimo ánimo de seguir luchando y trabajando para ayudar a su familia.  Entre el trabajo que ella hace (venta de comidas), también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para preparar los alimentos que vende, como ser carnes, condimentos, verduras, y demás.
texts.en: The San Jose Obrero group is on its fourth loan cycle. The committee is made up of women, where they all work hard and help each other so that, through working together, they can help their families to get out of poverty. One of the members is Mirian, who in her last survey was at a level of poverty within level one, which is red, or below the poverty line. Despite this, she has a lot of energy to keep fighting and working to help her family. In addition to the work that she does (food sales), the work of the other members should be emphasized. They follow a system of training and verifications that demand and at the same time encourage the women to fight to overcome poverty. Mirian is asking for the loan to buy ingredients to prepare the food that she sells, like meat, condiments, vegetables, and more.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, and more

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de tierra y cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Luís Espinal de la Ciudad del Alto, donde se encuentran en trámite de urbanización del lugar.

Actualmente trabaja de mecánico - muñonero, el lugar están ubicado sobre la tierra y lleno de grasa y aceite de auto sucio, el trabaja todos los días de la semana. Su trabajo es independiente trabajando actualmente en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, colabora a su familia con el pago de los servicios, comida.

El crédito lo requiere para herramienta de trabajo(llaves inglesas, martillo,desarmadores) ya que cuenta con muy pocas herramientas con los cuales trabaja, y así mejorar sus ingresos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Daniel is single and doesn't have any children. He lives in his parents' house, which has a good atmosphere, a bedroom and kitchen. The room is made of adobe and the floor of earth and cement. The house is located in the Luís Espinal area of El Alto, a place in the process of urbanization.

Daniel currently works as a mechanic. His place of work is outside and covered in grease and oil from dirty cars. He works every day of the week. At the moment he is self-employed and works in the area of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. He helps his family pay for food and bills.

Daniel needs this loan to buy work tools (wrenches, hammers, screwdrivers) since he has very few tools to work with, and in doing so, increase his earnings.

This is the first time he is requesting a loan from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy wrenches, hammers and screwdrivers to continue his work as a vehicle mechanic.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a 54-year-old married woman from Garcia, Bohol. She has three grown children. 

Clara has been operating her small sari-sari store or variety store business for 40 years now. This is the source of her income. This is where she works for the needs of her family. Her husband is a driver.

Clara is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to sell, like canned goods, biscuits, soy sauce, vinegar, soft drinks and beverages. These are the items that she sells in her store. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy more items for her store to attract more the attention of the customers in her local community.

In the future, Clara hopes to expand her business and to gain more profit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell, like canned goods, biscuits, soy sauce, vinegar, soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Ma. Myrna

texts.en:
Ma. Myrna is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown up children from Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Ma. Myrna is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, soda, cooking ingredients, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store thus increasing her sales and profit. In the future, Ma. Myrna hopes to expand her business and make it sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, soda, cooking ingredients, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Rosario Del Milagro

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. se dedica  a la elaboración de prendas de vestir como faldas y blusas esta actividad la aprendió de sus familiares que también se dedicaban ha esta actividad con 15 años de experiencia. Esta actividad la ejerce en su casa se habitación en donde tiene la confesión de la ropa. Su esposo es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y aporta al sostenimiento de la familia.  

Como es un servicio que ella presta los clientes les llevan las telas, para que se las confeccione y lo que compra es: hilo, botones, zíperes, semis dure para las blusas, etc.  Estos accesorios los compra en tiendas que se encuentran ubicadas en la ciudad que esta a una distancia de 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación.
      
El prestamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 500 ladrillos, 50 bolsas de cemento, 10 quintales de hierro de diferentes pulgadas, 1 camionada de arena y Pago de mano de obra. Para la construcción de la cocina; ya que la casa en donde vive es de adobe y esta se llena de mucho humo cuando cocinan. Por eso quieren tener una cocina que será construida de ladrillo. Al construir la cocina; ya no estará en su casa no tendrán enfermedades respiratorias por que ya no estarán inhalando el humo  de esta manera podrán pasar mas tiempo en la vivienda por que ellos cuentan que cuando están cocinando se salen de la casa por el humo. 

Ella desea, seguir con el mejoramiento de la vivienda; por que es de adobe ella quiere construirla completa de ladrillo aun que sea mas pequeña de la que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Rosario is 49 years old, married and has two children. She makes items to wear such as skirts and blouses and learned the skill from relatives who also engage in this task. She has had 15 years of experience. She makes the clothing in her home. Her husband is a farmer and grows basic grains to help support the family.

Since she provides a service to her customers, they bring their fabrics to her so that she can make the garments. Thus she buys thread, buttons, zippers and other notions to make blouses, etc.. She buys these accessories in stores located in the city about 3 kilometers from her home.

She is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to purchase 500 bricks, 50 bags of cement, 10 hundred pound weights of iron of different lengths, 1 truckload of sand and pay for the labor force. They will be used to build a kitchen because the house where she lives is built of adobe and it fills with smoke when she cooks. Thus she wants to have a kitchen built of bricks. When the new kitchen is built the family will no longer risk respiratory diseases because they will not be inhaling smoke and will be able to spend more time in the dwelling. Nowadays, when she cooks everyone has to leave the house because of the smoke.

Rosario wants to continue improving her dwelling because it is made of adobe and she wants to re-build it completely of bricks even though it may be smaller than the one that she has currently.

loans.use: to purchase 500 bricks, 50 bags of cement, 10 hundred pound weights of iron of different lengths, 1 truckload of sand and pay for the labor force in order to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Doña Raquel es soltera y tiene un hijo que esta  en etapa de lactancia, vive en alquiler donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio, la cocina se encuentra en la misma habitación, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Tunari, en la ciudad de el Alto.
Actualmente trabaja ayudando a su hermana en el servicio y venta de pollos al spiedo, trabaja todos los días de la semana  para cubrir el pago de los servicios, comida, vestimenta y el cuidado de salud de su hijo.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una máquina que cocina pollos al spiedo, ya que desea mejorar en su fuente de trabajo ayudando a su hermana y así mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de la Sra. Raquel es poder tener su pensión propia y usar la máquina de pollos al spiedo y así tener mejor ingreso y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Raquel is single and has a son that is still breast feeding. She in an apartment with a layout with the kitchen in the same room as the bedroom. It is adobe and has dirt floors. The home is located in the zone Villa Tunari in the city of Alto.
Today she works helping her sister in the service and sale of rotisserie chicken. She works every day of the week to cover the costs of services, food, clothing and healthcare for her son.
She needs a loan to purchase a machine to make rotisserie chicken, and wants to improve in her source for work helping her sister to improve her income.
Raquel's dream is to be able to make her own living, have a better income, and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a machine to cook rotisserie chicken, the business in which she helps her sister.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SANTA RITA, Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Silvia tiene 24  años dos hijos de las edades de 7 y 5 años se dedica a la venta de perfumes y colonias y cosméticos por catalogo,  es promotora de productos de belleza ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Silvia va a usar este préstamo  para comprar perfumes y colonia por mayor que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Silvia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y salir adelante  sola, la Sra. Silvia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos caso al igual que ella sacan adelante a sus familiaS solas.
texts.en:
The Santa Rita Communal Bank is composed of eight members, six women and two men. The president of the bank is Sra. Silvia who is 24 years old and has two children, aged 7 and 5.

Silvia sells perfume, cologne and cosmetics by catalog. She promotes beauty products by selling door to door. She visits both public institutions and private homes in different neighborhoods, where she offers her products. This loan is part of the group’s first loan cycle with Emprender. Sra. Silva is going to use this loan to buy perfume and cologne she finds on promotion at wholesale prices so that she will have them in stock for her business. The reason she is requesting this loan is to have a variety of products to satisfy her customers.

Sra. Silvia confronts challenges in her business, which include providing efficient service to her customers. She is going to use her profits to improve her family’s quality of life because this is the only business that enables her to support herself and get ahead on her own. Sra. Silvia is happy and grateful for Emprender because of the support provided to her and the other members of her bank many of whom, like her, are working to move their families ahead on their own.

loans.use: to purchase perfume and cosmetics wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, syrup and coloring in order to make sweets to sell.

loans.name: Luis Agner

texts.es:
LUIS ES UN JOVEN DE 19 AÑOS DE EDAD CON MUCHAS GANAS DE SALIR ADELNATE, el vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial los cultivos de limón y arroz. Luis solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de administración de empresas, pero debido a sus pocos recursos económicos no lo pudo lograr.

Día a día Luis trabaja en una tienda de venta de abarrotes, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; él cree que está saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque es responsable.

Luis está muy agradecido con el apoyo que le están brindando los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando podrá realizar el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi, de esta manera tendrá un vehículo en buenas condiciones  ya que es una movilidad necesaria para poder repartir mercadería los clientes de su centro de trabajo, con el fin de seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio propio y seguir apoyando a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Luis is a young 19 year old with a strong desire to get ahead. He lives in the city of Guadalupe which is characterized for its friendly and warm climate. Here agricultural activities, especially limes and rice, are carried out. Luis could only study up to the fifth year of secondary school but he would have liked to study Business Administration. Due to limited economic resources he could not do so. 

Everyday Luis works in a grocery store, working about nine hours daily and attending to about ten customers daily. He believes that he is getting ahead in his work because he is very friendly with his clients and is responsible. 

Luis is very thankful for the support that is being brought to him through the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help provided he will be able to pay for maintenance and repair to his moto-taxi. In this way he will have his vehicle in good condition because it is a necessary vehicle for bringing merchandise to his customers from his work place. This allows him to continue the fight to make his greatest dream a reality: having his own business and continuing to support his parents.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es separado y tiene un hijo, el cual está en etapa escolar; viven en casa familiar, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto.

El estudió solo hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica  a la costura recibe y agarra contratos en trabajos de costura de ropa deportiva como también ropa de trabajo, tiene puestos de venta en la zona de ciudad Satélite de la ciudad del Alto de la ciudad de La Paz, le ayuda su hijo en los cortes de tela.

El crédito lo requiere para aumentar capital y comprar telas, botones, hilos y cierres ya que comenzaron las clases, y se presenta más afluencia de clientes. 

El sueño que tiene Samuel es convertirse en un comerciante mayorista en la venta de ropa deportiva y ropa de trabajo. Así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Samuel is separated and has one school-age child.  They live in the family home located in the Ciudad Satélite area of the city of El Alto.

He studied up to secondary school and currently makes a living sewing.  He gets contracts to make athletic clothing and work clothing.  He has sales stalls in the Ciudad Satélite area of El Alto.  His son helps him cut the fabric.

He needs the loan to increase his capital and buy fabric, buttons, thread, and zippers because classes have begun and there are more customers.

Samuel's dream is to become a wholesale merchant of athletic wear and work clothing.  This way he'll be able to improve his family's quality of life.

This is the first time he's requesting a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread, and zippers

loans.name: Mardea

texts.en:
Martha, age 31, sells rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and other such food items to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past five years.
