She would like the lender to always help her with the financial support to achieve her dreams. 

In the photo Akuguzibwe is with the UGAFODE Microfinance Limited staff.

loans.use: To pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie lives in West Point, Montserrado County, which is noted for being the most commercial city in Liberia. She is 47 years old and has seven children between 10 and 31 years old. Only three of her children are in school and two live at home. 

For a year now, she has been selling cold soft drinks and cold water in the local market. One of the problems she faces is small capital. She enjoys the profit she makes every day, and having money for her expenses makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold soft drinks and cold water for her business.

Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cold soft drinks and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Mrembo Group

texts.en:
Dunstone is a member of Mrembo Group in Kakamega South District. He is pictured as one of eleven One Acre Fund farmers, nine women and two men. Dunstone is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Dunstone first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Dunstone joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices.

Dunstone reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about two bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 6 1/2 bags per 1/2 acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and buy a pig. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Dunstone’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 1/2 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Oruj

texts.en:
Oruj is 48 years old. He lives in the small village of Lagodekhi District. Oruj has a large family: his wife, two sons, daughter-in-law, mother-in-law, and two grandchildren. Oruj requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a greenhouse where cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. They sell the harvested products seasonally. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Oruj requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Oruj will use his loan to start a car wash. He will purchase the essential equipment and a vacuum cleaner. Oruj will provide services to his local community members and hopes to increase the monthly income of the family. A little part of the loan will also be used for purchasing the seeds to sow in his greenhouse. 

His new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed to start a car wash.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a single mother with one child and her only child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling beef stew. She has applied for a loan  of 300000/= Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more beef, garlic salt and other spices.  She works at the market and sells to all categories of people but at a retail basis and works six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to start a bakery and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more beef, garlic and other spices for roasting beef.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 49 years old and lives in the town of West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She lives with her husband, who has his own business. They have three children between 17 and 23 years old. Two of them are in school and the oldest one is out of school. 

For six years Beatrice has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. Sometimes she does not have enough money to buy more stock since the prices are not stable and getting much more expensive every day. She likes to talk with her customers and learned how to cook from her mother a long time ago. 

Beatrice has requested a loan to buy more fish, bush meat, rice, pepper, charcoal, oil, vita, bowls and cups to increase her customer traffic. In the future she would like to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish, bush meat, rice, pepper, charcoal, oil, vita, bowls and cups to increase her customer traffic.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a permanent resident of Katembe, a village in Isingiro district. He is 47 years old. He is married with eight children and two dependents from his uncle, who died four years ago. All his children and dependents are in school. 

From childhood, Emmanuel has been a farmer and a banana (plantain) seller. In 2008, he learned through a friend of the existence of UGAFODE Micro finance Limited. He was funded with a loan of UGX 1,500,000 which he used to build a semi-permanent house to accommodate his family. 

Now, he is requesting for a loan UGX 1,500,000 to buy windows for his house since, in its current state, it is prone to thievery and mosquitoes (see picture attached). He is hopeful that his family will live under better security and conditions when the house is complete. 

He is grateful for the partnership with UGAFODE Micro finance Limited as well as with the Kiva lenders. In the picture, from left to right, is Emmanuel, his guarantor who signed the waiver form, and the UGAFODE credit officer. Emmanuel is illustrating to them what he wants to do on the house.

loans.use: To buy windows for his house.

loans.name: Sang'alo D Group

texts.en:
The Sang'alo D Group has 10 farmers, one man and nine women, and is located in Bungoma South District. Colleta is the featured borrower, and is pictured on the right of Sang'alo D Group with her hand raised. 

She is asking for a loan capable of planting a ½  acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Colleta joined One Acre Fund during the long rains 2009, and is now enrolling in the long rains 2013 season. Colleta joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and access the best prices. 

Colleta reports that before the One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about two bags of maize per acre, but with her One Acre Fund loan during long rains 2012, she harvested eight bags per 1/2 acre! 

Colleta described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to improve her living standard by being able to afford basic needs, and to buy a cow. 

During the 2013 long rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Colleta’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as focused and determined. 

She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens and eggs. In addition, Grace has rental houses from which she gets income.

Her business is located within a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 32,700 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by her family. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is married and has two children who both go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees. 

She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for four years. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenge includes thieves who steal charcoal at night and seasonality.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She aspires to sell charcoal at her home, to educate her children up to university and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Crecyl Jane

texts.en:
A married mother of two, 25-year-old Crecyl Jane lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. For over four years, she has owned and operated a tricycle transportation service, earning about 4,000 PHP per month.

Crecyl Jane, who joined GDMPC in 2009, is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires for her tricycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase another tricycle.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle tires and spare parts.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a petty trader at Soba, Hohoe. She has never been to school. She is single and has two children. Over the past years she has helped support herself and her extended family members. She is responsible for paying the school fees of her younger siblings. 

Elizabeth has been in the petty trading business since 2008. Her loan will be used to buy tins of Milo, milk, biscuits and other provisions. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to enable her and her business to build a better future.

loans.use: to buy tins of Milo, milk, biscuits and other provisions.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 34 years old and lives in the town of West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county; She lives with her partner, who has his own business, and they have four children age 3 months to 15 years old. They live at home with her and three attend school.
 
For three years now Alice has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. She likes the interaction with her customers and learned how to cook from her mother a long time ago. 

Sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy her ingredients wholesale and has to buy retail, which is much more expensive. Alice has requested a loan to buy oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken foot, and charcoal for her business. In the future she would like to own a car.

loans.use: to buy oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken foot, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Beckey's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members, Rebecca and Hasia, who sell jewelry and clothes respectively in the Dansoman community. They have been a group since 2011.

Rebecca, a 38-year-old single parent of one child, has been selling jewelry for the past three years. She works from Monday to Saturday from her home or hawks to her customers. This enterprise has enabled her to educate her child. She is now requesting her third loan for GHS 1,000 to buy more jewelry to sell.

In total, the group needs GHS 1,700 to buy more goods for their respective businesses.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry and supply to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Mila is married and has six children. 

To make a living, Mila owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of different products, such as canned goods, vegetables and soy sauce, in the local community. Mila has been in her business for 12 years and earns 8,000PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Mila joined GDMPC. Mila is requesting a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to have a comfortable house.

loans.use: purchase more items, such as canned goods, vegetables and soy sauce

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 50 years old. She is married with four children and she is from Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Analiza owns farmland and operates a farm, harvesting and planting corn to sell in order to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns 12,000 PHP per month. 

In 2011, Analiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Analiza is requesting a loan amount of 22,000 PHP for the purpose of purchasing fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to expand her corn production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia vive en Curicó, Chile donde vende pan, queques y cremas de piel. Las cremas son para ambos cara y cuerpo y 100% naturales que se compra desde Temuco y las vende en Curicó y Santiago. Se va a usar su préstamo para compra  cremas, dejar un poco ahorrado y comprar insumos para hacer pan y queques porque estos productos los vende en colegio a partir de Marzo. Un día Sonia le gustaría crecer su negocio, y instalarse en Santiago con un local y seguir vendiendo sus productos. Sonia tiene 72 años, tiene 4 hijos y 4 nietos. Le gusta trabajar con Fondo Esperanza por la unión que hay en los grupos y el fortalecimiento de las relaciones entre ellos.
texts.en: Sonia lives in Curicó, Chile, where she sells bread, cakes, and skin creams.  The creams are for face and body and are 100% natural.  She buys them from Temuco and sells them in Curicó and Santiago.  She's going to use her loan to buy creams, to put away a little money, and to purchase ingredients for making bread and cakes to sell at the school starting in March.  One day Sonia would like to grow her business and open up a shop Santiago and keep selling her wares.  She's seventy-two and has four children and four grandchildren.  She likes working with Fondo Esperanza because of the unity and the strength of relationships within the groups.

loans.use: to buy skin creams, ingredients for bread and cakes, and to put away a little in savings.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Joven Juan Carlos trabaja para una empresa privada, su  mayor sueño es tener su casa propia y mejorar de condiciones el y su familia. a el se le dificulta un poco reunir el dinero por que tiene que cubrir los gastos del hogar, con este credito comprara lo necesario par continuar con la construccion, como puertas, cemento, arena etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, a young man, works for a private company. His biggest dream is to have his own house and improve his family’s living conditions. It is difficult for him to collect all the money he needs, because he has to pay for the home’s expenses.

This is why he is requesting a loan to buy everything he needs to continue building his house, such as doors, cement and sand. He appreciates the help that AFODENIC and Kiva give him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 48 years old. She is married with five children and she is from Molicay, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Anita owns farmland and operates a farm, harvesting and planting rice to sell in order to earn. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Anita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to buy farm equipment.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Evonnie

texts.en:
Evonnie is 37 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She was unable to attend school, but she says she is good at managing her business. 

She is married and has four children between 3 to 13 years old, all of them are in school and live at home. For the past six years, she has been selling  soft drinks in her community. She has a lot of customers and makes more profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. She hopes to improve her business and send her children to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business,

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 50 years old and widowed with four children. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. 

For over five years, she has been doing manicures and pedicures for her clients in the local community. She earns 3,000 PHP per month. 

Amelita joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan amount of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional beauty equipment/tools for her services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to have her own salon.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty equipment/tools for her services

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 57 years old and married. She is the mother of four children. She lives in Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Teofila plants and harvests corn, which she sells to her contract buyer in town. She has been in this business for 15 years. Aside from corn production, she also has a business selling snack foods in the community. Through her sideline business, she earns a monthly income of PHP 550 and through her corn harvesting she earns about PHP 2,100 per month.

Teofila joined GDMPC to gain financial access to capital. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Reunion Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Reunion” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are requesting a loan of 2,800,000 Sierra Leone leones from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Sahr. Sahr is age 51; he was born in Koidu city, in eastern Sierra Leone, but he is currently residing in Makeni, together with his wife and six children. His wife is a businesswoman and five of his children are attending primary and secondary schools.  

Sahr sells gara lappers (locally dyed clothes) and body lotions. With his share of this loan, he is going to expand his business by producing a larger quantity of gara clothes for sale. He will also buy a large quantity of body lotions to add to his current ones.

loans.use: to buy materials for producing gara lappers (locally dyed clothes)  in a large quantity in order to produce a larger quantity of gara clothes.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana is 25 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market in Montserrado county.   She is single, with two children aged 3 and 6 years, who live with her and are in school.  For the past two years, she been selling  cosmetics at the local market.  The rainy season is one of her biggest challenges.   Joana is requesting a loan to purchase  cosmetics for her  business.  She likes her business because people responded very positively to it.  Her long term plan is to buy a small piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase  cosmetics for her  business,

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 56 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidenal. She owns and operates a charcoal business in the local community to earn a living. She's been with her business for over 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2009, and now she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for charcoal selling.

loans.name: Dora's Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of three members who have been accessing loans from ID Ghana since 2010. They are Dora, Charles and Gertrude. They sell foodstuffs, cooking utensils, cloth and eggs.

ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Dora is a 50-year-old trader who is married to Armstrong, a 59-year-old civil servant. They have four children. She sells cooking utensils and eggs, and she has 10 years of experience. She works six days in a week (from Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve her business capital. This is her seventh loan with ID Ghana, and she is requesting an amount of 3,000 GHS (Ghana cedis) to buy more goods to sell to her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 7,800 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils and eggs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro, tiene 42 años de edad, casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al departamento de Intibucá. Leandro toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva más de 15 años de cultivar maíz, frijoles y papas. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. El ha invertido varios prestamos en los cultivos, dándoles buena asistencia, actualmente esta solicitando el onceavo préstamo que es por 15,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar semillas de papas, abonos y va pagar mano de obra para siembra y mantenimiento de estos cultivos. Su objetivo es darle una mejor asistencia para incrementar el volumen de producción para mejorar los ingresos.
texts.en:
Leandro, age 42, is married and has six children.  He lives in a village in the Intibucá department.  Leandro has worked in farming his whole life.

He has been growing corn, beans, and potatoes for over 15 years.  He sells this production at the local market.  He has invested several loans in his crops by providing the crops with good care.

He is now requesting his eleventh loan, and it is for 15,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy potato seeds and manure.  He will also pay for the labor to plant and maintain these crops.  His objective is to give greater care to the crops to increase his production volume in order to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Teodulo

texts.en:
Teodulo is 51 years old and married with three children. He lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For more than seven years, he has owned and operated a motorcycle transportation business in the local community. He earns 3,000 PHP per month. 

Teodulo joined GDMPC in 2009. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP so he can purchase spare parts and tires as well as pay for the registration and maintenance of his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires as well as pay for the registration and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and married with three children. She lives in Bliss, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over five years, she has owned and operated a Computer Encoding business in the local community, and earns 5,000 PHP per month.

Evelyn joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase an additional computer for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase another Desktop Computer

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Salamatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Salamatu was born in Makeni city 40 years ago. She is married to a trader, and the couple has six children – three in primary school and three in secondary. Salamatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells dishes, bowls, drinks, etc.

This group of entrepreneurs has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Leones for the entire group in order to further expand their respective businesses. Salamatu will use her share of the loan to buy dishes, bowls, drinks, etc., in a large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy dishes, bowls, drinks, etc., in a large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Abu B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 25,700,000 Sierra Leone leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to buy or invest in things that they would not otherwise be able to buy or invest in left with their salaries alone. Some usually use these loans to buy plots of land, house-building materials, to pay school fees for their children, to buy pieces of furniture, etc. And at the end of each month, they use their monthly salaries to repay the loan. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Abu is the leader of this group. The 42-year-old is married to a trader, and the couple has six children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Abu has been a teacher for 17 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cement, rods, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house. 

(Attached on the right of the photo are pictures of Abu Bakarr and Fatmata, who are members of the group but were not present for a group photo.)

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cement, rods, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 35 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children, ages 9, 11, 14 and 19 years old; all of them are in school and live at home. 

She has been selling soft drinks, juice and cold water for the past three years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the buying. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, juice and cold water for her business. In the future, she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, juice and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda is 33 years old and lives in the town of West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is single and lives with her partner. They have three children, between the ages of 10 to 16, that live at home with them, and attend school.

For six years Finda has been running a cook shop (restaurant) at the local market. Sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy her ingredients wholesale, so she has to buy them retail, which is much more expensive. She learned how to cook from her mother long time ago and enjoys the interaction with her customers at the restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken foot, and charcoal for her business. In the future she would like to build her business and own a car.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken foot, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 43 years old and married with three children. She is from Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Lorna owns farmland and operates a farm, where she plants and harvests rice to sell in order to earn money for their future. She has been in this business for 11 years and earns 9,000 PHP per month. 

In 2008, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a loan of 9,500 PHP for the purpose of purchasing fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to expand her farm operations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 33 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is married and has three children between the ages of 9 and 18 years, who live with her and are in school.

For a year, she has been selling soft drinks, biscuits, bread, and cookies and opes to expand her business. The rainy season is her biggest challenge. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional inventory of soft drinks, bread etc. for her business. She likes her business because of the way people positively responded to it. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase  soft drinks, biscuits,bread, and cookies, for her  business,

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is 21 years old and lives in the town of Ijevan with his parents and brother. He studies at Yerevan State University, in the department of history. 

Ashot's parents work hard to sustain their family and it is very difficult for them to save money for Ashot's education.

Ashot has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition. The loan is very important for Ashot because it will enable him to complete his education and become a good specialist.

He dreams of finding a well-paying job so he can help his parents sustain their family.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Fatmata from Moriba town Bo. She is married, with three children. Her children are currently attending school. She started this food business because she did not go to school and her mother trains her with business.

Fatmata runs a local food business. She sells palm oil and gari. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business eight hours per day. She says that her business is the only income she has.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to establish herself and her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari for her food business.

loans.name: G.s. La Holla Y El Comal Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario la Holla y  el Comal está conformado por tres mujeres, madres solteras, con 5 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de la Paz Centro. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La Paz Centro se caracteriza por sus comidas y bebidas típicas. Como el quesillo y el tiste. Son mujeres trabajadoras, responsables lo han demostrado en los créditos anteriores en tiempo  y forma. Lamentablemente ninguna pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.
 Gracias a su tenacidad y sus ganas de adelante tienen sus diferentes negocios. María Magda es la coordinadora del grupo   y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa y calzado como pantalones, vestidos, camisas, short, camisetas, juegos de sabanas, toallas, zapatas deportivos, tenis, de cuero , sandalias. La rutina de trabajo de Magda es trabajar unas 10 horas diario de forma ambulante, con un peso de unos 20 kg ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto porque es el sustento de sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. El grupo solidario la Holla y el Comal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas  kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "La Holla y El Comal" [the Pot and the Griddle] is made up of three women, single mothers with five children in their care.  They are from Paz Centro, located in the western part of Nicaragua.  La Paz Centro is known for its traditional foods and beverages like quesillos [sour cream quesadillas] and tiste [corn and cacao drink].  They are responsible and hardworking women, which they have shown in every way in prior loans.  Unfortunately, due to lack of resources, none of them was able to go to school.

Thanks to their tenacity and desire to get ahead, each has her own business.  María Magda is the group coordinator and sells footwear and clothing including pants, dresses, shorts, t-shirts, sheet sets, towels, soccer shoes, sneakers, leather shoes, and sandals.  Her routine includes traveling around for ten hours each day with twenty kilos of goods which she offers to current and prospective customers.  She really enjoys running the business because it supports her children.  She is seeking a loan to invest in working capital to stock up her business because in the not-too-distant future she would like to bring in more income.  

The "La Holla y el Comal" solidarity group appreciates the help Kiva lenders offer people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so those people can have a semblance of a decent life.

loans.use: to put into working capital and stock up her business buying and selling footwear and clothing like pants, dresses, shirts, shorts, t-shirts, sets of sheets, towels, soccer shoes, sneakers, leather shoes, and sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more material to sew and sell to customers.

loans.name: Lydia Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members -- Lydia and Ruth.  They decided to form a group to access credit from ID Ghana in 2011. They sell palm oil and kenkey (sourdough dumplings) respectively.

Lydia is 33 years old. She is married to Maniel, a 37-year-old mason. She sells palm oil with 15 years' experience and works from Monday to Saturday. She buys from the market in the eastern region and sells in the Dansoman community. This is her fifth loan with ID Ghana. She needs a loan of GHS 1,400 to buy more goods to sell to her customers. 

The entire group needs an amount of GHS 2,200 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell to their customers.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 65 years old, from Gata Daku, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widow with 1 child. She owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting rice to earn a living. She has been in business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP per month.

In 2010, Consolacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Consolacion is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to support her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 28 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county.  She is married, her husband is a teacher.  She did not go to school, but has two children aged 2 and 5, both of whom go to school.  

For more than three years she has been selling soft drinks and bread from a table in front of her house.  Her biggest challenge is rising prices, but she still manages to make a profit.  Her mother helped her to start the business, and she feels that the business enables her to gain her independence.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks and bread for her business.  In the future, she plans to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and bread for her business.

loans.name: María Rebeca

texts.es: María busca el sustento diario tras varias actividades y sacando provecho de lo que aprendió de algunos familiares quienes le enseñaron el negocio de la crianza de cerdos para su posterior comercialización en el mercado,hace 4 años logró establecerla gracias a los conocimientos adquiridos y de la cual está pendiente todo el día, alimentando a los cerdos, aseándolos, etc. Además de esta actividad, María elabora prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros, lo que le permite adicionar sus ingresos para tener el sustento diario sobre su mesa. Cuando ella haya obtenido más ganancias en este negocio, espera poder comprar máquinas de coser para incrementar su negocio de confección de ropa. Ahora María solicita un préstamo para poder adecuar los criaderos de chanchos para que los animales tengan el cuidado necesario y así no sufran de ninguna enfermedad. Aunque a lo largo de los últimos años María ha salido adelante sola, agradece a quienes intervengan con su granito de arena para que ella pueda crecer económica y laboralmente.
texts.en:
María supports herself through various activities, making the most of what she learned from some relatives who taught her the business of raising pigs to sell in the market.  She set up this business four years ago thanks to the knowledge she acquired.  She does this work all day, feeding the pigs, washing them, etc.

In addition to this activity, María makes clothing for women and men, which allows her to add to her income to put food on her table.  She hopes to be able to buy sewing machines to expand her clothing business when she has earned more profits from this business.

Currently María's requesting a loan to be able to make adjustments to the pig pens so the animals get the care they need and don't suffer any illness.

Although in the past few years María has gotten ahead alone, she's grateful to the people who make their contribution so she can grow financially and in her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make adjustments to the pens

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Kadie from Torkpoi town Bo. She is married, with two children, between the ages of 2 years and 15 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2005, Kadie established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to get a permanent source of income. She works at the business six days per week, nine hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes the business is very difficult to operate because of price inflation.

Kadie requires a loan in order to buy more gari and palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and buy electronic items for her personal use. In the future, Kadie plans to build a house and expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gari and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Fatmata from Torkpoi town Bo, a married mother of two children between the ages of two and four years. She started her business to create income for her family.

For five years now, Fatmata has been running a raw fish and chicken business within a busy market area. She works from morning until night, seven days per week. Because whe needs capital to more effectively conduct her enterprise, Fatmata has requested a loan to buy more fish and chicken to sell. The extra income arising from this loan will enable her to increase her business and improve her status.

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more fish and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La Sra. Marisol tiene 22 años, tiene un hijo de 1 años, se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace 3 años ella confecciona ropa deportiva, su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Carpenter. Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Marisol va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión. La Sra. Marisol enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes, La Sra. Marisol es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Marisol is 22 and has a one-year-old son. For the past three years, she has been making sportswear in the workshop in her home in Carpenter. This will be her first loan cycle with the institution, and Marisol will use the loan to buy fabric to make garments to sell at wholesale. She is requesting the loan to increase working capital.

The business challenge Marisol faces is increasing income. She will invest her profit in the purchase of material to make high-quality garments and fill more customer orders. Marisol works hard and is happy and grateful for the institution's support.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 48 years old from Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Merlinda owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas and coconuts for a living. She has been in business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP per month.

In 2008, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda is requesting a loan of 23,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to Increase the income of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Hawa from Kandeh town Bo. She is married, with three children between the ages of three months and eight years. She started a business because she did not go to school; her mother trained her to do business.

Hawa runs a general food commodities business. She sells palm oil, dried fish, and bread. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business throughout the week. She says that her business is doing well. 

Hawa has requested a loan in order to buy more food stock, like palm oil and dried fish. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living and to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more food stock for her business, like palm oil and dried fish.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 20-year-old single young woman. She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Maha's brother appears in her Kiva profile photo. She is a university student who wants to complete her studies. Maha's mother is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

Maha is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. She will use her laptop to do her homework and papers and help in her studies. Her loan will ensure a better future for Maha and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop computer

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 36 years old, married with 7 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community, to earn a living. She's been in this business for over 6 years and earns 7,000PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in 2010. Gina is requesting a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes and dreams for her children to have a better future and that they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure
